videos.title: Surfer Experiences Terrifying Wipeout in Nazare, Portugal
videos.description:
A surfer experiences a terrifying wipeout in Nazare, Portugal, as a huge wave hits surfer Thiago Jacar√©, who has a dramatic rescue to get him out of the water.

A dramatic video of the incident shows Thiago Jacar√©, 35, hit a bump and fall as he rides a giant wave. 

He is immediately swallowed by a wall of white water and is held down for several seconds.

He surfaces just in time to catch a breath before taking another monster wave on the head. 

His teammate, big wave surfer David Langer, is unable to rescue Jacar√© on his jet ski because he's floating around right in the impact zone.

Eventually, after taking a total of five waves on the head, German surfer Sebastian Steudtner manages to pick up Jacar√© on his jet ski and whisk him away from danger to the beach.

Although completely exhausted, Jacar√© was unharmed in the terrifying ordeal.

He was taken by ambulance to hospital as a safety precaution.

"This was by far the worst wipeout of my life, I barely got the chance to breathe between waves," Jacar√© later told the filmer.

"When I got to the sand, I was completely exhausted, to the point I couldn‚Äôt even move," he added. 

‚ÄúI want to thank Sebastian Steudtner for the rescue...I won't ever forget this day!‚Äù he concluded.

Thiago Jacar√© is an experienced big wave surfer from Brazil. 

He worked for many years as a professional lifeguard and is also involved in the organisation of big wave competitions in Brazil.

Praia do Norte beach, near the fishing village of Nazar√©, became famous worldwide for huge waves in 2011 when Hawaiian surfer Garrett McNamara set a world record for the largest wave ever surfed.

videos.title: Terrifying accident overshadows surfing tournament
videos.description:
Subscribe to The Surrey Newsroom here :- https://youtu.be/WDKd4fenEbs

Big wave surfer Alex Botelho of Portugal was rushed to hospital on Tuesday (February 11) after being involved in a serious accident during the Nazare Tow Surfing Challenge. Clip courtesy of worldsurfleague.com.
Botelho was being towed back to shore on the back of a jet ski but was caught amid colliding waves, which flipped the jet ski high into the air. He was washed into shore unconscious where dozens of rescue staff rushed to his aid. He was treated at the scene before being taken to hospital.

Tuesday's event featured 10 teams comprised of two athletes, alternating between surfing and driving the team's ski. Each team competed twice in hour-long heats with a priority system to ensure all riders were able to catch sizable waves.

Hawaii's Kai Lenny claimed the men's wave of the day. While France's Justine Dupont captured the women's title. Lenny and teammate Lucas Chianca of Brazil won the team competition.

Source: WORLD SURF LEAGUE
Topics: Disaster/Accidents, Sea Accidents
Source News Feeds: Audio Soundbites, Reuters Marketplace - Video

videos.title: SLOW WITH ZO√â GROSPIRON
videos.description:
Ah time! Our dear time, what a pleasure to be talking about you. You who decides of everything, who regulates our day and our life, and, at some point, who defines what is fast and what is, by opposition, slow. Zo√© is definitely fast, running around all day, never losing a second. I, on the contrary, can be considered as slow. My life is basically slow in the morning and not too fast in the afternoon which is funny because you manage to see things differently.

Take a camera for example. Its speed determine how much time its sensor will have to print everything it sees on a card or a film. Set it up on a high shutter speed, at around 1/2000 sec, it will only show you what happens in this timeframe as it will assemble into an image. Less data equals sharp images.
Now, set it up on a low speed, at around 10 sec. With A LOT more data to assemble, it will first take time to process (I told you it was slow...) and then you will end up with a very blurry outcome. No perfect recollection of what happened, but a special interpretation, giving you, more or less, only a vibe of the moment.

And now, welcome to my slow life, where everything is a blur!

With that in mind, and our life being so fast, everyone trying their best to do more and fit the most into their day, I thought it was time to sit down and enjoy the moment. Having Zo√© as a muse was obvious, as she has always been open to new ideas, really motivated, curious and a really smooth and talented longboarder. I also thought mixing someone fast with something slow could be interesting.

And with all that reading, you still don't know what it's about... Don't worry, I'll get to it! So, initially, with this project, I wanted to slow things down (not her surfing though), and focus on things we don't normally have time to focus on. Take gliding for example. How is gliding on a longboard different? How does it feel? What is the best feeling Zo√© can get? Hard questions to answer with words as we don't take time to reflect on them. "Dance", "approach", "elegance", "flying", "addictive", and  "art" came into the discussion which, as you understood, does not focus on surf performance.

To emphasize my point about slow, I decided to shoot Zoe‚Äôs fast surfing with a slow shutter speed, gathering the best moments of our discussion with the best images. All of this topped by a music specially composed to suit her surfing, her style and her feelings. The outcome is about putting the original vibes of surfing into the main focal point, with a slow edit all about the vibes of Zo√© Grospiron's surfing.

name: Alyssa Spencer
bio: Alyssa Spencer is a professional surfer known for her powerful and progressive style in the water. At a young age, she has already made a name for herself on the international surfing circuit.

videos.title: LOST.TV - BEST OF ANDY IRONS
videos.description:
The best of Andy Irons' clips from the ...Lost videos.

Three time world champion Andy Irons has passed away. Andy was a longtime friend to many and a ...Lost family member. We'll miss you Andy.

Most of the clips shot in this video are by two of Andy's friends: Pat Eichstaedt and Skip Miller.

videos.title: The Most Brutal Rivalry In Surfing History
videos.description:
This changed surfing forever‚Ä¶

"The Most Brutal Rivalry In Surfing History." This isn‚Äôt just about competition; it‚Äôs about the clash of titans, the epic showdown between Kelly Slater and Andy Irons that defined a generation of surfing. Dive deep with us as we explore the fierce battles, the mutual respect, and the intense moments that made every surf contest feel like an epic saga. From heart-stopping waves to behind-the-scenes drama, this rivalry had it all. But what made it so intense? You'll have to watch to discover the depths of their competition.

Get ready to be transported to iconic surf spots around the globe, where Slater and Irons went head-to-head in pursuit of surfing supremacy. This video is a rollercoaster of emotions, showcasing the highs and lows of professional surfing, the passion, the dedication, and the relentless drive to be number one. Through exclusive insights and breathtaking footage, we'll reveal how this rivalry wasn't just about winning; it was about pushing the limits of what's possible on a surfboard. Hit subscribe, like, and share for a front-row seat to the most monumental moments in surfing history.

name: Antony Garrett Lisi
bio: Antony Garrett Lisi, known as Garrett Lisi, is an American theoretical physicist. Lisi works as an independent researcher without an academic position.

name: Barton Lynch
bio: Barton Lynch is an Australian former professional surfer known for his competitive prowess and style. In 1988, he was crowned ASP World Tour Champion. He also won the 1991 Rip Curl Pro. In 1998, he was inducted into the Australian Surfing Hall of Fame, and in 2000, he was inducted into the Australian Sporting Hall of Fame. The video game Barton Lynch Pro Surfing is named after Lynch.

name: Bethany Hamilton
bio: Bethany Meilani Hamilton is an American professional surfer and writer. In 2003, she survived a shark attack in which her left arm was bitten off; ultimately, she returned to professional surfing and wrote about her experiences in the 2004 autobiography, Soul Surfer: A True Story of Faith, Family, and Fighting to Get Back on the Board. The book was adapted into the 2011 feature film, Soul Surfer. Hamilton attributes her strength to her Christian faith.

videos.title: 20 years ago I was attacked by a shark, and lost my arm..
Bethany Hamilton Surfs  Teahupo'o
videos.description:
This past October the first big swell of the 2018 season hit Teahupo‚Äôo, Tahiti. When Bethany Hamilton spotted it on the charts a week prior, she immediately booked flights, got her boards ready and flew to the island paradise to take on ‚ÄúThe Wall of Skulls‚Äù. She‚Äôd been waiting for the chance to get solid Teahupo‚Äôo, and she wasn‚Äôt about to miss the opportunity.

‚ÄúA week or so before the swell hit my brother Tim texted me about the forecast, and it looked amazing,‚Äù Bethany told us. ‚ÄúI was hoping it was a bit bigger to whip a few but it wasn‚Äôt. It was a fun challenge to paddle with some of the guys though! I‚Äôm always game to go to beautiful Tahiti! It‚Äôs such a beautiful and intimidating wave. For me, positioning and direction of swell is super important for catching waves.

‚ÄúOver the years I‚Äôve learnt that you‚Äôve got to be willing to try the so-called ‚Äòimpossible‚Äô and hold true to who you are and what gets you fired up.‚Äù

And for Bethany, that‚Äôs chasing Teahupo‚Äôo. Watch her do her thing‚Ä¶

name: Bianca Valenti
bio: Bianca Valenti is a professional big wave surfer known for pushing the boundaries of women's surfing. She is a pioneering advocate for gender equality in the sport.

videos.title: INSIGHT: Bianca Valenti
videos.description:
http://www.TheSurfChannel.com

Thanks to unstoppable women like Bianca Valenti, the world of big wave surfing isn't exclusive to men. Growing up in San Francisco, California, Valenti is no stranger to the heavy surf breaks located in Northern California. Mavericks, Marin County, and Ocean Beach are just a few of the spots she spends most of her time charging.

In 2014, she earned first place in the Dive n' Surf Oregon Pro at Nelscott Reef after participating in the first ever women's heat during a Big Wave World Tour event.  Valenti believes in the power of positivity, and is one of female big wave surfing's greatest ambassadors. Learn more about her competitive lifestyle, training, worst wipeout, most frightening moment in life, and more in this episode of Insight.
___

videos.title: Final Surf Stop San Francisco With Big Wave Surfer Bianca Valenti
videos.description:
The epic California surf trip ends in San Francisco. On their final stop, Hunter Jones and Lex Weinstein meet up with Big Wave surfer and change maker Bianca Valenti at Ocean Beach, home to howling winds, cold water, and potentially the best barrel of your life. They surf the city's famous (and challenging) wave, score some "Sushi-ritos" on the Burrito-meter, and paddle out with the City Surf Project at Pacifica. Hunter and Lex hand out the final Saltiest Local Award to a Kelly's Cove legend, and then cap off the trip with one of the most picturesque surf sessions that California has to offer. 

San Francisco is the traditional and unceded homeland of the Ohlone people. The original people of the San Francisco peninsula are the Ramaytush Ohlone, with Ocean Beach being the homeland of the Yemalu Ramaytush and Pacifica the homeland of the Aramai Ramaytush.

videos.title: Wipeout at Mavericks surfing big waves
videos.description: Grant Twiggy Baker wipeout at Mavericks surfing big waves. Giant waves! Scary moment when one of the worlds best surfers wipes out on one of the biggest waves in the world. This is big wave surfing. This is a wipeout at Mavericks in Half Moon Bay California.

videos.title: The heaviest surf moments at Mavericks 2014
videos.description:
Get updated on Mavericks and other huge surf stories at http://win.gs/1alYVe2
On the biggest day of the winter, Mavericks lived up to its ferocious reputation and gave the best big-wave surfers in the world a contest deserving of their mettle and might.

Where do we begin.

Today, during the fourth and probably most anticipated event of the Big Wave World Tour, the waves, a chilly 18-20ft+ (up to 50ft faces), were persistent and giving. Massive, heaving bowls, tippy-toe air drops, a few 2-wave hold-downs, Jet Skis and inflatable vests were a prevalent sight as well.

That -- and a South African named Twiggy, who pretty much owned the entire day.

While in the early rounds, guys like last year's champ Peter Mel and Ryan Augenstein put on a clinic, flexing that local knowledge, the semis also had their share of epic battles.

While Greg Long dueled with Shaun Dollar, Mark Healey dueled with a set on the head, a perspective caught on his GoPro cam attached to his board -- which you NEED to watch on the site's heat analyzer. Truly unbelievable.
But then the final rolled around and the man with a heart like a Nor-Cal redwood with a nickname called Twiggy, stole the show, catching twice as many waves as the other five guys in the heat, including a gut-wrenching perfect 10.

Ross Williams said it best of the man, "Twiggy doesn't just go for broke, he also shows control, riding every wave all the way into the channel. But he's usually deepest too, of course."

Indeed he was. So deep on most in fact, that Twiggy was airdropping on his toes, then catching a heel-side rail, but regaining to push around the guillotine. Bawse-drops.

Although 2nd place Shane Dorian surely gave Baker a run for his money, also air-dropping into a few impossibly steep and rowdy bowls, Twigs prevailed, a man utterly possessed the entire event.

Said the sponsorless Twiggy Baker, "The prize money's great, but the thing is, even if none of us had sponsors or there was no event: we'd still all be out here today. We just love it." Amen, you maniac, you.

The Finals results go as follows:

1. Grant "Twiggy" Baker ‚Äî 29.33
2. Shane Dorian ‚Äî 25.532
3. Ryan Augenstein‚Äî 16.663
4. Tyler Fox ‚Äî 12.664
5. Greg Long ‚Äî 12.000
6. Anthony Tashnick ‚Äî 0.006

_________________________________

name: Brenden Margieson
bio: Brenden Margieson, born on July 3, 1972, is a former Australian professional surfer, widely recognized as one of the pioneering free surfers to achieve substantial financial success in the sport. In 1996, he secured victory at the inaugural Nias Indonesian Pro and earned the title of "Best free-surfer in the world" in consecutive years according to Australia's Surfing Life. Known by the moniker "Margo", he is often praised for his stylish regular foot, characterized by a smooth and powerful technique, making him a captivating presence in the world of surfing. Margieson remains a cherished figure in Australian surfing.

videos.title: Surf tip: How to surf in the moment with Brenden Margieson
videos.description:
Do you try to plan out your wave? Or do you just go with the flow? @margomargs says that his best surfing happens when he stops planning and starts surfing in the moment.

In this week‚Äôs episode of the Basis Surf Podcast, I‚Äôm joined by Brenden Margieson (@margomargs), hailed by many as the world‚Äôs ‚Äòbest-ever free surfer.‚Äô Margo‚Äôs iconic style has left a lasting mark on generations of surfers, and in this episode, we‚Äôre lucky to have him share his wisdom. From mastering carves and roundhouse cutbacks to developing your natural style and refining your positioning and timing, this episode is packed with invaluable tips to level up your surfing. Don‚Äôt miss the chance to learn from one of the best in the game!

name: Brianna Cope
bio: Brianna Cope is a professional surfer known for her powerful and stylish approach to the sport. She has competed in numerous international competitions and continues to push the boundaries of women's surfing.

videos.title: Surfing to Cope Official Trailer
videos.description: Hi everyone! Im so excited to announce my film Surfing To Cope will be available on iTunes October 8th. Im so excited to share my story with everyone. Here is the offical trailer to Surfing To Cope:)  please make sure to like and subscribe!

videos.title: Welcome to the Pro Sol-team, Brianna Cope üèÑ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
videos.description:
Welcome to the Pro Sol-team, Brianna Cope, Professional Surfer üèÑ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è üß°

Aloha!

My name is Brianna Cope, I'm a professional surfer from the beautiful island of Kauai! I was born and raised on the South Shore of Kauai. Growing up near the ocean, I fell in love with its beauty and power. I started surfing at the age of 4. My older sister Gabrielle and my dad taught me how to surf on a longboard. They would push me into waves, and from that day on I was hooked. I love how free and alive I feel in the ocean. It is such an indescribable feeling to be able to ride a wave, always thinking how special it is that you can only ride that wave once, you will never get the same wave again!

I started competing at the age of 10, winning my first surf competition when I was 11 years old and from that moment I knew I wanted to be a professional surfer. I have been competing ever since. I am currently competing on the World Surf League qualifying series, traveling across the globe for competitions! My ultimate goal is to be on the world tour. I have always been a firm believer of ‚Äúwhere there is a will there is a way‚Äù. In 2018 I came out with a documentary called ‚Äú Surfing to Cope‚Äù which is now on iTunes.

Do you have questions about Sol-ti? Email hello@solti.com and we will gladly address your questions.

For more information:

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/drinksolti/

videos.title: Welcome To My Channel | Brianna Cope
videos.description:
Welcome to my channel, i'm so excited to launch my channel and show you more of my life! You might know me as a professional surfer, but there is much more to me that i want to share. I was born and raised on the island of Kauai, surrounded by natural beauty and the ocean. Growing up on a island surrounded by water, I discovered the ocean was my second home. 

Surfing has taken me all over the world and i want you to join me on this adventure! Join along my everyday life and get a behind the scenes view. :) Please subscribe and join me on this journey!

videos.title: Brianna Cope announces ABC Network's new show "The Ultimate Surfer"
videos.description:
Exciting day!! Brianna Cope, one of our pro athlete has been keeping this under the radar until she got cleared from ABC network to announce that she will competing and cast in the new show The Ultimate Surfer Hosted by world surf icon Kelly Slater. The show will consist of the best surfers from around the world competing amongst each other to be titled ‚ÄúThe Ultimate Surfer‚Äù and win a grand prize of a 100 thousand dollars!

Anyways, we didn‚Äôt want to spoil too much so we asked a little bit about her training regiment and how Muay Thai compares to surfing!

name: Butch Van Artsdalen
bio: Charles M. Van Artsdalen was a surfer. He moved to La Jolla, California, from his birthplace of Norfolk, Virginia, at age 14. Van Artsdalen is best known as a pioneer of surfing 25-foot waves at such North Shore locations as Waimea Bay and Sunset Beach; and tube riding in Hawaii during the early 1960-1970s. A member of the Duke Kahanamoku Surf Team, he appeared in several surf movies and remained a fixture of the international surfing community until his death from alcohol-related illness in 1979.

name: Buzzy Trent
bio: Buzzy Trent was a pioneer of big wave surfing. Born in San Diego and raised in Santa Monica, he body-surfed as a child and started surfing at age 12. He moved to Hawaii in 1952 to surf and pioneered big wave surfing along with George Downing and Greg Noll. Buzzy gained international fame in 1953 when he was photographed by Scoop Suzuki riding a 20-foot winter wave at MƒÅkaha in the first widely published photos of big wave surfing.

Compilation of the world's biggest waves ever surfed! World record waves around 100ft (30m) rogue waves, largest waves world record Biggest wave in the world Large wave, swell storm tsunami, code, red, jaws, teahupoo

Big wave surfing is the ultimate celebration of extreme surfing. Challenging deadly waves in harsh weather and ocean conditions takes a very serious approach.
Big wave surfers are not interested in performance. Forget perfect cutbacks, stunning floaters or breathless aerial antics. The profile of a big wave rider is the result of several unparalleled personal characteristics.

Fear is always present in a 50-foot wave. Fear is the best way of managing the risk of paddling for a huge wave face, which doesn't tell you what is going to happen and how it is going to break.

Monster waves tend to move quickly and force surfers to get away of the powerful whitewater. Big waves are lethal even for the most experienced extreme riders. The best big wave surf spots in the world have claimed several lives in the last decades.

Malik Joyeux, Sion Milosky, Moto Watanabe, Mark Foo, Donnie Solomon, Todd Chesser, Dickie Cross and Peter Davi have passed away in extreme surfing conditions. Wipeouts, severe coral reef injuries and drowning are the most common causes of death in big wave surfing.

The pioneers of big wave surfing started to eye impossible killer rides in the 1940's. In the 1960's, waves like Pipeline and Waimea increased the popularity of paddling into new wave heights. Going over the falls was the daily menu.

Laird Hamilton is the first professional big wave surfer. The waterman from Maui defies fast, hollow and high waves with a full-time training and previous preparation. Hamilton, the father of tow-in surfing, takes on the entire big wave spots of the Hawaiian Islands, in helicopter style.

Laird was born with the gene of defying danger. He designs and prepares his own surfboards and wetsuits. Wherever heavy waves break, Hamilton is there to ride them: Mavericks, Cortes Bank, Dungeons.


Garrett McNamara is one of the toughest big wave challengers. After riding a spectacular 78-foot wave in Nazar√©, Portugal, the Hawaiian waterman entered the Guinness World Records with the biggest wave ever surfed.

The 55 best big wave surfers of all time is an exclusive extreme surfing club. From Jaws to Mavericks, Puerto Escondido, Punta Lobos, Ghost Trees, Belharra, Shipstern Bluff and Todos Santos, these riders have set up a new scale in the definition of giant waves.

videos.title: CAITY SIMMERS Is The NEXT Big Name In Surfing
videos.description:
Caitlin Simmers is surfing‚Äôs North Star. At just 18 years of age the Pride of Oceanside has quickly grown from a lo-fi grom to the world stage‚Äôs headline act, whether she‚Äôs dropping insane video parts like Bell Jar, or claiming wins in Portugal and Brazil on her way to a fourth place finish in her rookie Championship Tour season.

The latest instalment of In Plain Sight sees Caitlin in her beloved hometown of Oceanside, San Diego, and reveals a little more about the gritty city and working class locals who have turned her into the global phenom we know and love today. We hear Caity‚Äôs thoughts on the joys of competing and travel (spoiler alert: not in that order), we hang out with her brother Timo, meet an 11-year-old Caity who‚Äôs blissfully unaware of the life she has to come, see her fall off a skateboard multiple times, and in amongst a plethora of filthy tubes and wild turns we find out if she still catches lizards now that she‚Äôs all grown up.

Whether you‚Äôre a surfer, skater, or simply someone who enjoys picking the brains of interesting humans you‚Äôll love spending time with Caitlin Simmers, so get comfortable, hit play, and settle in for 14-minutes of frenetic surfing and fun conversation. Enjoy.

videos.title: Caitlin Simmers vs Erin Brooks | Corona Fiji Pro presented by Bonsoy 2024 - Quarterfinals
videos.description:
Shop WSL and CT official merchandise at http://www.WSLStore.com

After a seven-year hiatus, Cloudbreak is back on the Championship Tour schedule as the ninth and final stop of the regular season. The 2024 Corona Fiji Pro presented by Bonsoy will see the top 24 men and 12 women return to one of the world's most perfect and iconic waves. This powerful, left-hand reef break will not only cap the regular season but will officially set the WSL Final 5 roster. 

Fiji has been home to some of the most memorable moments at the Championship Tour level, including a record four wins by 11x World Champion Kelly Slater who returns to the event this year as a wildcard. Fiji will also welcome back tour veterans such as Gabriel Medina, John John Florence, Tyler Wright, and Tatiana Weston-Webb as well as others who will be competing there for the first time including current world No. 1 Caitlin Simmers and Griffin Colapinto.

videos.title: From closeouts to 20-second barrels! Soli Bailey, Timo and Caity Simmers stumble into perfection
videos.description:
‚ÄúI told Timo, this is what we leave for. This is why you go so far from home.‚Äù - Caity Simmers.

OK, by now you‚Äôll have figured out what M2N is all about: a wing and a prayer, a mystery location, and a moment you‚Äôll never quite forget. But in ‚ÄúChasing Seconds‚Äù, the whole thing goes to a completely new level. Caity, Timo, and Soli are carried off to a surf zone they‚Äôre never heard of in their lives, driven by nothing more than explorer Matt‚Äôs remote-control research ‚Äî that and crazily pinpoint Surfline team forecasting. 

Nobody involved has ever visited this location. When they get there, what they see makes half the team want to go home. All anyone knows is that the forecast is telling us there‚Äôs swell on the way. But what will happen when swell meets sand? Is it a bust, or the barrel of your life?

This is the wildest discovery yet ‚Äî prepare to have your mind blown.

name: Canelle Lebreton

name: Carissa Moore
bio: Carissa Kainani Moore is an American surfer. She was the first-ever winner of the Olympic gold medal in women's shortboard surfing at the 2020 Summer Olympics. She is also a five-time world champion, winning in 2011, 2013, 2015, 2019 and 2021 on the World Surf League WSL Women's World Tour. Moore was the first surfer in history to win a WSL world title and the Olympic title in the same year.

videos.title: COCO | Episode 1
videos.description:
Hawaiian surfer Coco Ho begins her road to requalification for the Championship Tour. While she battles through the opening event of the Challenger Series, she examines how her iconic family‚Äôs legacy has impacted surfing, Hawaii, and her own stellar career at the highest level of the sport. 

As bright, honest, and dynamic as the surfer herself, this four-part documentary series follows Hawaiian Coco Ho on her road to requalify for the Championship Tour. While Coco battles through the Challenger Series in California, Portugal, and France alongside her brother Mason, she examines how her iconic family has shaped her unique place in the surfing world. With her comeback campaign finishing on the North Shore, the series ends where it all began for Coco, creating a dramatic homecoming that will determine the next chapter of her already stellar career.

videos.title: Top Best Surfers Moments 2020
videos.description:
Top Best Surfers Moment 2020 - Best Top Clips 

Hey Guys Thank You For Watching This Video 
This is a Compilation of Surfers best Moment i hope you like it.

WHAT IS SURFING ?
Surfing is the sport of riding waves in an upright or prone position. Surfers catch ocean, river, or man-made waves, and glide across the surface of the water until the wave breaks and loses its energy.
In the ocean, wave riders stand up on surfboards and navigate the water - nearly parallel to the beach - toward the shore. There are four types of surfing waves: spilling waves, plunging waves, surging waves, and collapsing waves. The ultimate goal of surfing is to ride and progress on the unbroken part of the wave using a surfboard. Nevertheless, beginners can learn to surf in the whitewater part of the wave.

Many surf historians and enthusiasts believe that the essence of surfing is in bodysurfing, the art of gliding over the waves using only the body as a planing surface.

name: Dale Velzy
bio: Dale Velzy was an American surfboard shaper, credited with being the world's first commercial shaper. He opened the first professional surf shop in Manhattan Beach, California, in 1950, personally hand fashioning the surfboards from wood or synthetic material. By 1960, Velzy owned five retail shops and three production facilities in California and Hawaii. He was known as "Hawk" for his keen eyesight.

videos.title: North Shore Surfing - Island Moments - Better Dayz - Surf Reel Hawaii
videos.description:
October 1st, 2022 was a beautiful morning on the North Shore. Sunshine, waves and good vibes blessed the island of Oahu.

Surf Report/Forecast:
Individual Swells
5.3FT at 10s NNW 340¬∫
3.2FT at 7s NNE 25¬∫
3FT at 4s NNE 25¬∫
0.4FT at 18s W 260¬∫ 

We walked down to one of our favorite local surf spot on the north shore, waxed up the board and launched the drone to capture epic island moments.

Hope you enjoy the video; if you are in the video and are interested in obtaining the clips for your own personal use or scheduling private filming, be sure to hit us up at Training.CCiSports@gmail.com

Follow and stay social on Facebook and Instagram for more content and community information.

@islandmoments.oahu 
islandmoments.oahu@gmail.com

Velzyland Surf Guide:

Named after veteran California surfer/shaper Dale Velzy, V-Land is like a miniature Sunset Beach, set in the big bay just beyond Backyards. At times, it can be hard to even see the break in the welter of water moving around the bay. V-land is shaded by Phantom Reef, the classic big-wave location that lies over a half-mile straight out to sea. Phantoms focuses swell into the bay, where most of it ends up connecting across to V-Land's neatly defined, shallow lava ledge. On a good day, it's a bowling barrel of fun, rippable sections -- a perfect training ground for the best North Shore groms, who take full advantage of the wave.

Ideal Velzyland Surf Conditions:

Swell Direction: WNW to NNW
Wind: Calm or light to moderate E to S.
Surf Height: Chest high-3 feet overhead
Tide: Medium

LOCATION HIGHLIGHTS: Velzyland has both right and left breaks, and is a  more of an advance wave with a crowded surf  Surfers still flock to it when the

BREAK WARNINGS!: Parking is alongside the road, which can't be seen from the beach, and cars have been known to be stolen on occasion. Be sure not to leave any valuables in your car. The reef here is some of the sharpest in the North Shore. Also, the currents can be very strong here and the waves massive. It is best to stay out of the water unless you are an experienced surfer.

videos.title: IBA Bodyboarding THE ARICA CHILEAN CHALLENGE - Tuesday 25/05 - Damian King
videos.description:
Arica Chilean Challenge
El Gringo, Chile
May 20th - 29th 2011
ibaworldtour.com

A further decrease in swell has forced event organisers to call a second consecutive lay day of the Arica Chilean Challenge. This dip in swell is considered the calm before the storm, as forecasts are predicting a flurry of long range swells sending 10 foot plus surf from a South Westerly direction. Event Organisers are expecting an explosive finish to the event as the world's best battle it out at maxing El Gringo, one of the most notoriously heavy and dangerous waves.

The daily call will be made at 7:30am local time, (1:30am Hawaii, 1:30pm Cape Town, 7:30pm Perth, 9:30pm Sydney).

Don't miss a beat, use the IBA World Clock to find out what time it is in your zone and log onto IBA website for all the updates.

For regular updates go to the IBA facebook page, where you can win World Tour paraphernalia just for joining.
Shop online at the IBA store where you can get you hands on limited Pipeline and Box event T's.

All the action from every IBA World Tour event is made available for live viewing via redbull.com 
The finals will be broadcast live at redbull.tv

When the contest is off or on hold, fans can have fun playing the wave of the event (El Gringo) on YouRiding BODYBOARDING online game.

MUSIC// Jaguar Spring - Shaky

videos.title: Movement 16 Preview
videos.description:
The surfing world stopped and stared slack-jawed at Hawaii for another winter while the world's best tried to back up all the talk. Our North Shore spread traces the moments that have made the place infamous, talks hierarchy in the line-ups and bangs out the biggest shots.

Jeff Hubbard stole away with the world title, the Pipeline Pro and this issue's profile. His performances have made the rest look slow and sluggish and for a quietly spoken man he's got plenty to say. We'll run a special feature on the Pipeline Pro contest - hailed as the best ever - showing how the spectacle played out with all the most memorable waves from the event.

Ben Player and Dallas Singer go man-on-man at a South Coast ledge in our other feature while Damian King talks sponsor drama, Ryan Hardy tours his new home and all the world champs fill our gang slot.

videos.title: IBA Bodyboarding PIPELINE PRO 2011 - Competition Day Three - Legends & DK
videos.description:
Feast claims first Grand Slam win

West Australian Kim Feast had his maiden victory on the IBA World DK Tour when he smashed the field at Pipeline to win his first ever Grand Slam final.

The lanky lad from Perth demolished his opposition with a polished display of tube riding in perfect 4-6 feet backdoor.

"I am so stoked" said Feast

"This is like a dream. To beat those guys in such good waves makes me even happier and I am not sure what to do from here"

" I was supposed to go to Uni this year after a year of globetrotting but now I have some decisions to make, actually a sponsor would help me make that decision with some support" he added.

The day started with some amazing waves rolling off the famed reef and the best riders in the world relished in the conditions.

" I really enjoy watching the Drop knee events" said IBA Tour manager terry McKenna

" Its like a hybrid of bodyboarding and surfing and adds a whole new dimension to the world tour"

In the opening rounds there were some major standouts

Port Macquarie locals Damian King and Mason Rose looked comfy on the rights and both scored big with deep tubes and front-side gaffs.

Kianoa McGee was also impressive as he continued to prove his versatility as one of the worlds best watermen when he continuously dialed up set after set and played hide and seek with the judges.

Portugal's Rui Perriera also showed why he is regarded as one of the best European's with stylish positioning and controlled barrels. 

The quarterfinals saw some of the more fancied favorites like Dave Hubbard (Hawaii) and Matt Lakey (Aust), Ardiel Jimenez (Canary Islands) exit the event as the conditions became inconsistent and wave selection became paramount.

The highlight was Ryan Hardy's 9-point cavernous barrel that had the crowd hooting.

The quit achiever of the day was Miles Kauhaahaa (Hawaii) who constantly found the best waves and showed glimpses of brilliance to dominate all of his heats.

Semi finals are always tough but at Pipe in the first Grand Slam of the year they are complicated.

Kianoa and Amaury wanted to go front-side but the N in the swell meant that the rights were dishing up the higher scores and both were sidelined by the left foot forward duo of Feast and Bauer.

Dave Winchester and Miles Kauhaahaa dominated the second semi and Hardy and McMullin were left wanting.

At this point the DK crew were given a breather as the IBA walked down memory lane with a tribute to the rich history of the sport and the event.

The Legends final was a masterstroke that showcased a handful of bodyboarding icons from the 90's that had either won the event or played a major role in the development of the sport in a 30 minute final.

The following riders were selected

Steve "Bullet" MacKenzie (Winner 1996)

Michael "Eppo" Eppulstun (Winner 1993)

Ben " Tube troll" Seversen (Winner 1986)

Pat "Noodle" Caldwell (Inventor of the el-rollo)

Hauoli "Martian" Reeves (Vibrant Hawaiian character)

These guys wound back the clock and old scores were settled as they traded blows and showed that they still have the skills that originally made them a household name.

Caldwell lead early and then the Aussie duo of Bullet and Eppo upped the ante with deep tubes and perfect positioning.

Ben Seversen made a late charge but a deep shack sealed the deal late and Bullet walked away the winner.

" I loved it" said Bullet 

" Having my family here and surfing against the boys again was such a buzz and I hoped the spectators loved it as much as us"

Eppo was second, Seversen third Pat claimed forth and Hauoli fifth.

This was a lighthearted lead in to an intense final and despite the surf being somewhat inconsistent Feasty grabbed two deep tubes to seal it.

Second place in the final went to the current world champion Cesar Bauer from Peru.

Bauer was throwing tail and drifting through his now trademark tail whips but when it comes to Pipe the tubes are what scores big and that's what Feast concentrated on.

Third place went to Winny and forth was Miles.

It was a perfect start to the 2011 DKWT and sets up the possible final day of competition for Tuesday.

Stay tuned for another call at 6.30am tomorrow

MUSIC// Mother and Son "Creature form the Swamp"

name: Damien Hobgood
bio: Damien Hobgood is a professional surfer from Satellite Beach, Florida. He is known for having once held the highest two-wave grand final score in pro surfing by scoring 19.9 out of 20 at The Quiksilver Pro Fiji in 2004 until Kelly Slater eclipsed it the following year at Teahupo'o in the final with a perfect 20. He is also known for his starring role in the autobiographical documentary film "And Two If By Sea" narrated by comedian Daniel Tosh.

name: Dave Kalama
bio: Dave Kalama is a big wave surfer/tow-in surfer, stand-up paddle (SUP) surfer and racer, surf and SUP board shaper, windsurfer, outrigger canoe racer, private adventure guide, and celebrity watersports enthusiast. Kalama, his wife, 2 sons and 1 daughter live in Kula, Maui.

videos.title: Dave Kalama | Watermen | Part 4 of 6 | Clean Break
videos.description:
Subscribe for more: http://full.sc/P0GZep

DAVE KALAMA
His name is known around the world.  He is a descendant of one of the most respected families within the surfing community. He is considered a true waterman and pioneer of modern day stand up paddle surfing and thought of as an ambassador of tow surf. One of his greatest conquests was being able to team up with his close friend Laird Hamilton and stand up paddle across all the major channels of Hawaii. He has a long list of awards and achievements between both windsurfing and paddleboard and has been featured in such iconic surf films as "Riding Giants" and "Step into Liquid". He received the Beacon Award at the Maui film festival in 2005 honoring him for living life beyond limits, outside of fear, inside courage and inspired by wonder; which is believed to be key components every true waterman should embody.

Clean Break
What if you had the chance to experience more adventure in one week than you could possibly have in an entire lifetime?  To cut loose from your job, the routine of your daily life, and be allowed to just live.  Clean Break gives three regular guys a chance to do just that.  To pack it up, leave it all behind, and push themselves emotionally and physically beyond what they thought they were capable of.  How much would you risk?  How far would you go to break free and find out what you're made of?

Check out our new show The 4 To 9ers
A comedy about the pains and passions of high school kids who work after the bell rings.

name: Dennis Wilson
bio: Dennis Carl Wilson was an American musician, singer, and songwriter who co-founded the Beach Boys. He was their drummer and the middle brother of bandmates Brian and Carl Wilson. Dennis was the only true surfer in the Beach Boys, and his personal life exemplified the "California myth" that the band's early songs often celebrated. He was also known for his association with the Manson Family and for co-starring in the 1971 film Two-Lane Blacktop.

videos.title: 'Surf Police' John Belushi and Dan Aykroyd force Brian Wilson out of bed to surf for first time
videos.description:
Flashback: John Belushi and Dan Aykroyd Force Brian Wilson to Surf
‚ÄòSurf Police‚Äô order the Beach Boy into Los Angeles ocean on a 1976 NBC special

The Beach Boys were in the middle of a major comeback when they hit the road in the summer of 1976 to promote their new album, 15 Big Ones. Earlier in the decade they were struggling to fill theaters and seemed hopelessly pass√©, but the huge success of American Graffiti in 1973 and stadium reunion tours by CSNY and Bob Dylan with the Band the following years showed that 1960s nostalgia could be extremely lucrative when presented in the right way.

Kicking off the Beach Boys comeback was the greatest hits double LP Endless Summer, which hit shelves in June of 1974. Richard Nixon was two months away from resigning and the country was in a deep funk, so millions of people were delighted to relive their carefree youth by putting ‚ÄúFun, Fun, Fun‚Äù and ‚ÄúI Get Around‚Äù on their turntables. The album shot to Number One and Beach Boys tickets began selling like crazy. The group responded by putting together a new backing band and devoting nearly its entire show to 1960s classics.

The Beach Boys played a staggering amount of concerts in 1974 and 1975, but by 1976 they knew it was time to actually cut a new album. Manager Steve Love came up with the idea of a ‚ÄúBrian‚Äôs Back‚Äù campaign where the long-absent Beach Boy would produce the disc and join the group on tour for the first time in over a decade. It was the best way to maximize attention for the project, even though Wilson was 250 pounds and battling severe addiction and mental health issues.

He was placed under the care of Dr. Eugene Landy and coaxed into the studio, which caused no small degree of turmoil in a band that had grown used to operating in his absence. This also wasn‚Äôt the Wilson of 1966 and he had virtually no new songs or a clear idea of what he wanted to accomplish, so they ultimately decided to concentrate on cover songs like Chuck Berry‚Äôs ‚ÄúRock and Roll Music‚Äù and the Dixie Cups‚Äô ‚ÄúChapel of Love.‚Äù The handful of Beach Boys originals like ‚ÄúThat Same Song‚Äù and ‚ÄúSusie Cincinnati‚Äù were, to be charitable, underwhelming.

This all took place just as Saturday Night Love was becoming a major cultural force, and creator Lorne Michaels was a huge fan of the group. He got NBC to air a special called The Beach Boys: It‚Äôs OK in November that would mix live concert clips with comedy segments like Dennis Wilson judging a beauty pageant and Mike Love on an airplane. The highlight was an amazing bit where John Belushi and Dan Aykroyd dress up like the ‚ÄúSurf Police‚Äù and march into Brian‚Äôs bedroom, telling him that he‚Äôs in violation of the ‚ÄúCatch A Wave Statute‚Äù and he has no choice but to go surfing.

The scene switches to a Trancas, California, beach where Brian is forced into the water, still wearing his robe, and somehow manages to not drown while attempting to surf. The joke, of course, is that the author of ‚ÄúSurfin‚Äô U.S.A.‚Äù had never actually been surfing. ‚ÄúHe was not happy about it,‚Äù Michaels told Rolling Stone in 2006. ‚ÄúIt was almost a baptism.‚Äù

Rolling Stone photographer Annie Leibovitz was on the beach at the time and captured the amazing image that appeared on the cover of a November 1976 issue. In a 2006 interview with Rolling Stone, Wilson said he could vividly recall the photo shoot. ‚ÄúI was saying to myself, ‚ÄòGod, I hope I can keep this robe on so nobody can see my belly!'‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI was very self-conscious about my weight. When you look at this [cover], my belly doesn‚Äôt look that big because I have the robe on, but believe me, it‚Äôs big!‚Äù

name: Derek Ho
bio: Derek Ho was a Hawaiian Chinese surfer who won the world surfing championship in 1993. Ho was born in Kailua, Honolulu County, Hawaii. He began surfing at the age of three, and won the world title at age 29, making him the first Native Hawaiian world champion. Derek Ho was the brother of Michael Ho, another champion surfer, and the first cousin of Don Ho, the Hawaiian singer. He was the uncle of professional surfers Mason Ho and Coco Ho.

With a heavy heart the surfing world lost a true champion. Derek Ho was a kind, friendly charismatic human with amazing ocean talent, crafty competition skills and a true zest for life. Derek won numerous surfing events and Vans Triple crown titles and also is the first surfer from Hawaii to Win the coveted ASP world title. He was a father, a friend and spirit we will never forget. RIP champ. üôèüèº. We will be planning a tribute issue and documentary to tell the story of our friends amazing life. @derekho1980 @volcomhawaii_ #restinpeace #aloha. name: Dewey Weber
bio: David Earl Weber, known as Dewey Weber, was an American surfer, a popular surfing film subject, and a successful surfboard manufacturing businessman. Throughout the 1950s and 1960s, he distinguished himself with a surfing style unique at the outset of that era. Out of the water, he had already become a national yo-yo champion and a CIF champion in wrestling, then appeared in several feature films, and eventually established a successful surfboard manufacturing company. On November 14, 2015, the city of Hermosa Beach unveiled at its Community Center a sculpture inspired by a photo of Dewey Weber taken by surf photographer Leroy Grannis.

name: Donald Takayama
bio: Donald Moke Takayama was an American professional surfer and surfboard shaper. Originally a longboard surfer, Takayama won the Master's division of the United States Surfing Champions in 1971, 1972 and 1973. Hawaiian born, Takayama learned to surf at Waikiki Beach and moved to California in the mid-1950s. Takayama died of complications from heart surgery; he is survived by his wife and four daughters.

On April 22, 2021 a cash-in-transit heist failed due to the evasive maneuvers and balls of steel this driver has.

Police spokesperson Brigadier Vishnu Naidoo said a group of men tried to rob the CIT vehicle on 22 April on the N4 in Pretoria, South Africa. As the suspects begin firing at the armored van, the driver keeps his composure extremely calm and passes his rifle to his partner.

The driver taking full control of the situation begins maneuvering his vehicle, ultimately pulling a U-Turn and heading straight at the suspects. Warning his partner moments before, "They are going to shoot" as they both brace for what's about to happen. Multiple shots make contact with the armored van as the by-pass the suspects car approaching, but luckily neither of them were hit.

Unfortunately the footage cuts off a few seconds after they pass the armed suspects, but the driver exited the vehicle what seemed to be safely.

The driver in this video is Leo Prinsloo, a former member of the SAPS Special Task Force, and also the head instructor for Fortis Pro Active Defence‚Äôs Lone Operator courses. Leo also is the founder of The Edge Shooting Academy in Centurion.

name: Eddie Aikau
bio: Edward Ryan Makuahanai Aikau was a Hawaiian lifeguard and surfer. As the first lifeguard at Waimea Bay on the island of Oahu, he saved over 500 people and became famous for surfing the big Hawaiian surf, winning several awards including the 1977 Duke Kahanamoku Invitational Surfing Championship. The Eddie Aikau Big Wave Invitational is named in his honor. He was also a crew member on the Polynesian voyaging canoe H≈çk≈´le ªa.

videos.title: 2023 Eddie Aikau Invitational Highlights: Best Waves in Historic Surf at Waimea Bay
videos.description:
What will we remember most about January 22, 2023 at Waimea Bay? Everyone who took part, whether it be watching from afar via our live broadcast, standing on the beach with jaws hanging down to the sand, or in the water trying to hunt ‚Äî we‚Äôll all have different memories. But when it comes down to winning the day, here‚Äôs the waves that really counted. As you watch, bear in mind how the event is judged in the context of the Bay‚Äôs unique complexities: the panel is looking for wave size, critical positioning on takeoff (ie steep and deep), control of the drop, and successful ‚Äúmake‚Äù, ie completion of the ride through and past the wave base. Rides into the shorebreak, while serious crowd-pleasers, aren‚Äôt big points-adders: as you‚Äôll note from this selection, the big points come from those first 10-20 seconds of the ride ‚Äî which also relies on the decision to go in the first place. (Also worth noting: waves are scored out of a possible 30, rather than 10. Also, Mark Healey‚Äôs wave above was so close ‚Äî 29.6 ‚Äî that we had to include here.)

It was an amazing day, however you saw it. We hope you enjoy these seven moments of magic.

Results (scores are out of a possible 90.)
1. Luke Shepardson 89.1
2. John John Florence 84.2
3. Mark Healey 82.3
4. Billy Kemper 79.5
5. Kai Lenny 76.7

8. Keali‚Äôi Malama 72.5

videos.title: Craziest Wipeouts & Rides 2023 Eddie Aikau BIG WAVE Surf Event
videos.description:
The Eddie Aikau Big Wave Invitational, is a big wave surfing tournament held at Waimea Bay on the north shore of Oahu, Hawaii. The tournament is named for native Hawaiian, champion big wave surfer, and life-saving Waimea Bay lifeguard, Eddie Aikau. 

This year Michael & Mason Ho are the first ever father and son to surf the prestigious event. Michael being 65 years of age and Mason 34. Its been a life long dream for both of them to surf The EDDIE together. Mason got a big bad gash on his leg prior to the event but wouldn‚Äôt miss this chance for anything. 

Surfers: Micheal & Mason Ho and many other Hawaiian and international hard charging surfers. 

Filming: Rory Pringle, Jake Hougified.

Location: Waimea Bay. 

Jams: 1980‚Äôs.

All surfboard info in end credit roll plus ding report. 

CONGRATULATIONS Luke Sheperdson!!!

THANK YOU AIKAU FAMILY!

videos.title: Eddie 2024, Best Rides Of An Iconic Day
videos.description:
The Rip Curl Eddie Aikau Invitational, starring winner Landon McNamara, Luke Shepardson, Billy Kemper, Jamie O‚ÄôBrien, Ian Walsh, Jake Maki, Ross Clarke-Jones and Joey Cadiz.

Riding big Waimea Bay is both a wild adrenaline rush and a quite subtle game of inches. You‚Äôre playing cat and mouse with an uneven rock ledge and a lot of swell energy, and you‚Äôre riding a board way bigger than you are. All the elements scream ‚ÄúCHARGE!‚Äù Yet even as you‚Äôre charging, all kinds of tiny things are happening. Little shifts of the board underfoot. Wind holding you up a fraction longer than you thought it might. You draw a simple line and it works, or it doesn‚Äôt. There‚Äôs a deep layer of grace and beauty under the wildness, and nowhere was it plainer to see than during yesterday Rip Curl Eddie Aikau Invitational, when the next generation of big wave greats showed all the skills and qualities this amazing event asks of a surfer. Here‚Äôs some of the best rides of an iconic day ‚Äî and a word or two from Uncle Clyde Aikau, keeper of the flame.

videos.title: Caitlin Simmers vs Erin Brooks | Corona Fiji Pro presented by Bonsoy 2024 - Quarterfinals
videos.description:
Shop WSL and CT official merchandise at http://www.WSLStore.com

After a seven-year hiatus, Cloudbreak is back on the Championship Tour schedule as the ninth and final stop of the regular season. The 2024 Corona Fiji Pro presented by Bonsoy will see the top 24 men and 12 women return to one of the world's most perfect and iconic waves. This powerful, left-hand reef break will not only cap the regular season but will officially set the WSL Final 5 roster. 

Fiji has been home to some of the most memorable moments at the Championship Tour level, including a record four wins by 11x World Champion Kelly Slater who returns to the event this year as a wildcard. Fiji will also welcome back tour veterans such as Gabriel Medina, John John Florence, Tyler Wright, and Tatiana Weston-Webb as well as others who will be competing there for the first time including current world No. 1 Caitlin Simmers and Griffin Colapinto.

name: Ethan Ewing
bio:
Ethan Ewing is an Australian professional surfer. 
Ewing had his best WSL performance in 2023, when he finished 3rd on the CT after the regular season. In the Rip Curl WSL finals, Ewing defeated Griffin Colapinto before falling to champion Filipe Toledo to finish 2nd in the world. He qualified for the 2024 Olympic Games.

Relive the Top 5 moments from the first Night Session where Caitlin Simmers, Griffin Colapinto, and Italo Ferreira shined, Ethan Ewing's ferocious run at the Ranch, Yago Dora dominating form on the left, Griffin Colapinto's claim to victory after finding his third final this year as he now secures the leaders jersey at the number one spot, and Carissa Moore securing the yellow jersey on the women's side as she takes home another victory at the ranch as well as winning her 28th CT event in back to back Wins.

videos.title: THE BEST ONE EVER - Moana Jones Wong
videos.description:
A Billabong Pro Pipeline series dedicated to those committed, skilled and fortunate enough to have caught ‚ÄúThe One‚Äù at the world‚Äôs most famous, most dangerous wave. In this episode, last year‚Äôs event champion and undisputed Queen of Pipe Moana Jones Wong tells us how she recently rode the best Pipe wave of all time by a female. Video Credit: Nigel Aird

We all have one ‚Äî that ride of a lifetime when everything comes together and becomes the personal benchmark for every wave ridden in the future. But when it comes to Pipeline, a ride like no other has a tendency to take on a more significant meaning. For some: it‚Äôs life-changing. For others: borderline-spiritual. At the very least, it‚Äôs guaranteed to stay seared in their memory for eternity. On the eve of the 2023 Billabong Pro Pipeline, we‚Äôve created a series dedicated to those committed, skilled and fortunate enough to have caught ‚ÄúThe One‚Äù at the world‚Äôs most famous, most dangerous wave. And hoping this inspires a few more ‚ÄúBest Ones Ever‚Äù at this event and beyond. 

As the epicenter of the surf universe and the birthplace of the sport, it‚Äôs only right for Pipeline to kick off the Championship Tour. Everyone enters the season with equal hopes of winning it all. The rookie class is thrown into the fire, the contenders return with one thing on their minds, and the surf world begins to follow the road to the Rip Curl WSL Finals. Pipeline sets the tone.
Watch live Jan 29 to Feb 10 on worldsurfleague.com.

For More Check Out:

name: Filipe Toledo
bio: Filipe Toledo is a Brazilian professional surfer who has competed on the World Surf League Men's World Tour since 2013. He is a second-generation pro who grew up outside of Ubatuba, Brazil, on the northeastern coast of the state of S√£o Paulo. His father, and long-time coach, Ricardo, was a two-time national champion. In 2014, as his career took flight, Filipe convinced his entire family to move to San Clemente, California.

videos.title: The Fastest Surfer In The World - Brazil's Filipe Toledo // All The 9s Since '17
videos.description:
Filipe Toledo has thoroughly earned that title, which once belonged to Rob Machado, since arriving on the scene more than a decade ago. The son of two-time Brazilian national surfer Ricardo Toledo, Filipe learned to surf in Ubatuba, just north of Sao Paolo, and is one of the most exciting surfers on the planet in waves under six-foot. 

After qualifying for the World Tour in 2013, Filipe has gone on to win 17 major ‚ÄòCT events, including back-to-back World Championships at the Rip Curl WSL Finals in 2022 and 2023 at Lower Trestles, in his second home, San Clemente, where Filipe his wife, kids, and family have lived for more than a decade. 

Known for his technical, explosive performances at waves like Jeffreys Bay, Snapper Rocks, and his backyard at Lower Trestles, Filipe took this year off tour to prepare mentally and physically for Teahupo‚Äôo this summer. 

With Joao Chianca and Gabriel Medina in his corner at the 2024 Paris Games, Filipe and Team Brazil will be eager to defend the country‚Äôs Gold Medal, won by Italo Ferriera in 2020.

videos.title: Girls Can't Surf | An empowering history of badass women
videos.description:
An empowering history of badass women.

The untold story of how a band of renegade surfer girls in the 1980s fought to create their own professional sport, changing surf culture forever. It‚Äôs the 1980s and the world of professional surfing is a circus of fluoro colours, peroxide hair and radical male egos. GIRLS CAN‚ÄôT SURF follows the journey of a band of renegade surfers who took on the male-dominated professional surfing world to achieve equality and change the sport forever. Featuring surfing greats Jodie Cooper, Frieda Zamba, Pauline Menczer, Lisa Andersen, Pam Burridge, Wendy Botha, Layne Beachley and more, GIRLS CAN‚ÄôT SURF is a wild ride of clashing personalities, sexism, adventure and heartbreak, with each woman fighting against the odds to make their dreams of competing a reality.

DocPlay streams a curated collection of the world's most amazing and thought-provoking documentaries.

videos.title: 3x World Champ Gabriel Medina // Best Of Gabriel Medina So Far This Year
videos.description:
Meet Brazil's Magician Gabriel Medina. Relive every excellent score Medina has laid down through the first 8 stops on the 2024 WSL Championship Tour ahead of Fiji. #wsl 

One of Brazil‚Äôs most promising groms in the early 00s, Gabriel Medina began his meteoric rise to the top as barely a teenager. In the final of the 2009 Quiksilver Pro King of the Groms against Caio Ibelli, Gabe dropped two tens and a perfect heat total to win the event and make a very big statement to the generation of supergroms assembled at the event, like Jack Robinson, Kanoa Igarashi, and others. 

While Gabe was always going to be a technical genius in small waves, his fearlessness and precision at some of the tour‚Äôs heaviest waves like Teahupoo or Pipeline is the result of relentless work to get better, stronger, and more comfortable in waves of consequence. 

Gabe won the Tahiti Pro in 2014 for the first time against the winningest surfer ever at Teahupo‚Äôo, Kelly Slater. The then twenty-one-year-old established himself with the performance as one of his generation‚Äôs most gifted all conditions surfers, and smoothly paved the way to his first World Title that year. 

The three-time WSL World Champion has been a perennially consistent standout at Teahupoo ever since, winning the event again in 2018, and making four runner-up finishes in 2015, 2017, 2019, and 2023.

name: George Freeth
bio: George Douglas Freeth Jr. was an American lifeguard, surfer, and swimming instructor of English and Native Hawaiian descent. His mother's side of the family ranked among Hawaiian royal ministers under King Kalakaua. His father's side of the family traced its ancestry to senior officers in the British military. Freeth's youth was spent in and around the ocean at Waikiki where he learned to swim and dive with local children. He later helped to renew interest in the traditional Hawaiian sport of surfing at Waikiki in the early twentieth century. He then popularized the sport in Southern California when he arrived in Los Angeles in 1907.

videos.title: California surf culture: New book looks at the life of early 1900s legend George Freeth
videos.description: Freeth taught surfing to lifeguards and others beginning in 1907

videos.title: Surf And Rescue: George Freeth and the Birth of California Beach Culture with Author Patrick Moser
videos.description:
Author Patrick presents the history of George Freeth who brought surfing to Venice Beach and all of Southern California. In the early 1900s, Freeth taught surfing and swimming, including coaching legendary waterman and Olympian Duke Kahanamoku. While working for visionary Abbot Kinney in Venice, and at beaches and bath houses in San Diego, Long Beach, Redondo, and Santa Monica, Freeth established modern lifeguarding practices still in use today. He transformed the beach into a destination for fun, sport, and excitement.

Presented at the Santa Monica History Museum, August 4, 2022

Website: https://santamonicahistory.org

videos.title: Exploring The History and Joy of Bodysurfing
videos.description:
In this presentation, I explore the fascinating history of bodysurfing, tracing its roots back to ancient cultures across the globe. I share insights on how bodysurfing has evolved and the importance of maintaining this joyful practice in our lives. I also discuss the impact of influential figures like Duke Kahanamoku and the recent revival of interest in bodysurfing. Please check the links in the description for more resources and information related to this topic.

CHAPTERS
00:00 Introduction to Body Surfing
04:00 Historical Overview
08:00 Cultural Significance
12:00 Modern Revival
16:00 Conclusion and Resources

videos.description:
THE INNERMOST LIMITS OF PURE FUN
(50th anniversary - Restored and remastered version)
1970 - Australia
1h12 - VOST
Directed by George Greenough

FR
Cette ≈ìuvre cin√©matographique majeure de 1970, a √©t√© enti√®rement re-num√©ris√©e et remast√©ris√©e pour offrir une nouvelle exp√©rience cin√©matographique saisissante.
Ce film est √† ne pas manquer, il s'agit d'un chef-d'≈ìuvre de la surf culture !
D√©couvrez l'Australie isol√©e et les coins de Californie m√©connus, en compagnie de Bob McTavish, Ted Spencer, David ¬´ Baddy ¬ª Treloar, Chris Brock, Gary Keys, Russell Hughes et d'une bande des riders underground.
Admirez le nord du New South Wales √† l‚Äô√©poque id√©ale, celle de la fin des ann√©es 1960, dans une perfection sans personne √† l‚Äôeau √† Lennox Head.
George Greenough t√©moigne de la r√©volution du shortboard telle qu'elle s'est d√©roul√©e en 1968.
Les innovations qui ont chang√© le surf √† jamais sont pr√©sent√©es √† travers son regard.
Vous d√©couvrirez ¬´ The Innermost Limits of Pure Fun ¬ª de l'int√©rieur, avec George dans des s√©quences de prise de vue r√©volutionnaires et uniques.
La bande originale, compos√©e en live par Dennis Dragon et Denny Aaberg du c√©l√®bre groupe Farm, se d√©marque par son improvisation.
Des orgues qui grincent et des basses qui claquent, le tout en collaboration avec des musiciens aux racines surf et blues.
Financ√© √† l'origine par les revenus de l'entreprise de p√™che de Greenough, ce film est enti√®rement libre de toute contrainte commerciale ou de publicit√©.
¬´ Vous n'y √™tes que quelques secondes en r√©alit√©, mais dans votre t√™te, cela dure des heures. 
C'est une exp√©rience difficile √† d√©crire, celle de rider √† l'int√©rieur d'une grosse vague qui grogne. 
Souvent, vous √™tes si profond√©ment enfonc√© dans le tube que vous n'arrivez pas √† en sortir. 
Vous √™tes terriblement secou√©. 
Ce qui compte, c'est le moment o√π vous √™tes √† I'int√©rieur de la vague, ce temps pendant lequel vous √™tes dedans.

This revolutionary masterpiece of a film from 1970 has now been fully rescanned and remastered into a stunning new cinematic experience.
Experience remote Australia and hidden California, as ridden by Bob McTavish, Ted Spencer, David "Baddy" Treloar, Chris Brock, Gary Keys, Russell Hughes, and a brigade of the underground's best.
Check out Northern New South Wales in the golden era of the late 1960s, with empty perfection at Lennox Head.
This release is essential to watch because it is a cinematic masterwork of the highest magnitude.
George Greenough chronicles ground zero of the shortboard revolution as it evolved in 1968.
This highly personalized film is the prime instigator's perspective of the innovations that changed surf-ing forevermore.
Explore "The Innermost Limits of Pure Fun" from the inside out, with George in groundbreaking point-of-view sequences that are utterly unique.
Hear the distinctive improvisational soundtrack, scored on the spot by Dennis Dragon and Denny Aaberg with their cult band, Farm.
Grinding organ tones and thumping bass with a collaboration of musicians with surf music and blues roots.
Originally financed entirely with the proceeds generated by Greenough's fishing business, this docu-ment is entirely free of any commercial restraints or advertising sludge.
"You might be in there for only a few seconds in real time, but in your head, it goes on for hours. It is an experience that‚Äôs hard to describe, riding inside of a big, grinding wave. Often you are riding so deep inside the tube that you don‚Äôt make it out. You take a terrible wipeout. What matters is when you‚Äôre in there, it‚Äôs the time interval when you‚Äôre inside the wave. Time enters space, a zone of its own. The only reality is what‚Äôs happening right then." George Greenough.

name: Gerry Lopez
bio: Gerry Lopez, aka Mr. Pipeline, is an American surfer, shaper, journalist and film actor.

videos.title: The Yin & Yang of Gerry Lopez | Patagonia Films
videos.description:
From award-winning documentary filmmaker, Stacy Peralta comes Patagonia‚Äôs The Yin & Yang of Gerry Lopez, a film that lifts the veil on one of surfing‚Äôs most enigmatic heroes. While ‚ÄúMr. Pipeline‚Äù is famously known for his calm demeanor in the tube, Gerry built his early career on cutthroat, aggressive surfing. Gerry is as radical as he is Zen; he transcends categorization. He‚Äôs one of the most influential surfers and surfboard shapers of all time, an entrepreneur, a family man, a movie star, and a lifelong yogi who brought surfing to new frontiers. His influence on modern surfing is immeasurable, and his story is being told in full for the first time.

Produced and Directed by Stacy Peralta
Written by Stacy Peralta & Sam George 
Produced by Monika McClure 
Executive Producers Evan Hayes, Alex Lowther, Josh Nielsen
Editor Paul Crowder

videos.title: Gerry Lopez, Hawaiian Surf Champion
videos.description: Gerry Lopez - Hawaiian Surf Champion Discusses His Outlook on Life. Gerry Lopez - Mr. Pipeline - know for his control of the Pipeline on the North Shore of Oahu is a legendary surfer (considered on the world's best in the early 70s), shaper, actor, journalist and now shaper of snowboards. At a recent event in support of the ICF (International Community Foundation) hosted by Mary and Jeff Werbalowsky in the home in Zacatitos, he joined other legendary surfers in a discussion of protecting our marine environment. HIs dedication to zen is also shown in this video as he compares surfing, the ocean and waves to life. His presentation inspires us to consider playing a more important role together in protecting the oceans. For more information on Gerry Lopez visit http://www.gerrylopezsurfboards.com For more information on ICF, which supports many Baja organizations in their protection of the environment visit ICfdn.org Thanks Fred Featherstone for the video.

name: Greg Noll
bio: Greg Noll was an American pioneer of big wave surfing and a prominent longboard shaper. Nicknamed "Da Bull" by Phil Edwards in reference to his physique and way of charging down the face of a wave, he was on the U.S. lifeguard team that introduced Malibu boards to Australia around the time of the 1956 Summer Olympics in Melbourne. He produced a "legendary" series of five Search for Surf films.

videos.title: Greg Noll's talks to about with life Tracey Holmes - shot in Sydney 2016
videos.description:
BIG wave surfing legend Greg Noll came to my home town Sydney in Australia back in November 2016 and i was lucky enough to interview him for my up & coming movie The BIG WAVE PROJECT.     I asked Australia's premier sport journalist Tracey Holmes if she who be happy interview this amazing man about his life at the beach which she agreed. This is what he talked about.

Early times/life on the Hawaiian islands - Makaha
Working for the California life guards to get to Hawaii.
Heading up to the North Shore.
How worked surfing amongst a crowd.
The early days, hanging out more with the Hawaiian guys.
Making boards in Wahiawa for the locals boys.
Just surf because we loved it, not into contests.
Talks about XXL and why you don't ride big waves for money.
The dangers of big wave surfing.
Talks about Greg Long's brush with death at the Cortes Bank.
Striving to ride a bigger wave..
Talks about riding the biggest wave at Makaha.
Whats it was like almost drowning although get used to it.
After 35 years, getting over the idea of riding the biggest wave.
Riding the first wave ever surfed at Waimea. Talks about those early years at Waimea Bay.
Talks about oceanographer Ricky Grigg. 
Riding Giants. Explaining to someone about riding waves.. relating to Australia
Whats happening these days in riding big waves and how its changed.
How the surf cameramen has contributed to the sport.
Talks about Midget Farrelly. 
Goes back talking about competing to come to Australia as a Aussie lifeguard which he did.
Where's the sport going - maybe the 100 foot wave.
Talks about the legends he surfed with back in the day. 
Goes on to talk about a classic Hawaiian friend/surfer Kealoha Kaio.
The Band Of Brothers.
George Downing
Sex & adrenaline
Living on the North Shore with no money. 'Livin like rats on fumes'..
On Buzzy Trent. More on George Downing
Then on Eddy Aikau & Clyde.
Making surf movies..
Getting a disclaimer from Greg for the interview..ha ha

Running inside the Vans US Open of Surfing, the second event of the Longboard Tour showcases creativity and traditional style while allowing fans to watch the most progressive longboarders on Earth face off on their quest for a World Title. Watch Honolua Blomfield, Harrison Roach, and many more live August 3-7 on worldsurfleague.com and vansusopenofsurfing.com.

At the iconic Huntington Beach Pier, Rio Waida, Caity Simmers, and the world‚Äôs top up-and-coming surfers face off in front of huge crowds as they battle to qualify for the Championship Tour and join the hallowed list of US Open champions. Watch the Vans US Open of Surfing live August 1 to August 7 on worldsurfleague.com.

Eithan Osborne throws a massive full rotation for the highest single wave score of the event (9.67) Kelis Kaleopaa takes down current world no.1 to make her presence known on the Longboard Tour, while Taylor Jensen enters the World Title chat. name: Ian Cairns
bio: Ian Cairns is a former champion surfer who was also influential in establishing the world professional surfing circuit and particularly the World Championship Tour. He was described as "the premier "power" surfer of his era [who] dominated the North Shore during the mid to late-seventies".

videos.title: Surfing Legend Ian 'Kanga' Cairns
videos.description:
Ian Cairns is the original power surfer, coach, entrepreneur and co-founder of World of Waves TV Show and Surfing.com.¬†

Growing up surfing in Western Australia provided Ian 'Kanga' Cairns as a 13 year old grom with the perfect training ground for the huge waves in Hawaii where he moved in the early 70's. He went on to win the Duke Kahanamoku contest in 75 a highlight in his surfing career. Ian was part of the Bronzed Aussie Surf Team traveling around the world as a stoked surfer looking for a good time.¬†

Ian became the Event Director for the OP Pro and formed the Association of Surfing Professionals (ASP), the first ever rule book and the foundation of the global surfing tour which became the WSL. His love of coaching saw him win titles with the US Team and he won a world title with Sean Poynter in SUP.

Ian is currently the co-founder of the World of Waves TV show and Surfing.com built around the concept of connecting people who love waves and travel. 

Tune in to find out more about Ian's favorite moments over the years from surfing massive waves in Hawaii, to coaching world champions and launching a TV show and what he has in store for Surfing.com

videos.title: 1968 Ian Cairns & Kevin Ager surfing Rocky Point WA - City Beach Surf Riders Club video
videos.description:
This short video features Ian Cairns age 16 from Southern Surfriders Club surfing with Kevin Ager from the Yallingup Board Club at Rocky Point WA in 1968. At the time Ian was WA State Junior Mens champion and Kevin State Spring Titles champion. 
In the video Ian is riding a short Jacko single-fin. He rode the same board in the 1968 Nationals held in NSW and won the Duke Kahanamoku trophy for the most promising surfer at the event.
In 1969 both surfers represented the State at the first National Championships held in WA. Ian was State Junior champion again and Kevin won the Annual Trigg Point contest run by Scarborough Board Club.
In 1970 Ian represented Australia at the World Surfing Championships held in Victoria at Bells and Johanna beaches and went on to become a pro surfer and surf contest organizer/promoter on the world stage.
In the 70s Kevin shaped surfboards for Cordingley & Blaxell Surfboards and took up sailing/surfing Hobie-Cats. He went on to win the  Australian National Hobie-Cat 16ft Championships held in WA in 1977.
City Beach Surfriders Club members shot this video using the Club‚Äôs hand-held Super 8 camera.
Run time 53 sec. Music by Yallingup musician Vance Burrow.

videos.title: Ian Cairns On Starting The ASP And Building The Foundation Of The Championship Tour | THE LINEUP
videos.description:
WSL Founder Ian Cairns talks about starting the ASP and building what would become the Championship Tour. He looks back at the early days of the tour, their crazy dream, patching it together ‚Äúwith chewing gum and masking tape,‚Äù the widespread growth of surfing worldwide, and wanting to end the tour in Australia. He describes living in Western Australia on a farm, surfing all the different waves there including Strickland Bay, the site of the Rip Curl Rottnest Search, and then explains how they relate to some of the iconic breaks on the North Shore. He tells stories from his own successful competitive career, talks title aspirations, details how he knew it was time to hang it up, and calls winning The Duke in 1975 the highlight of his career. 

#WSL

videos.title: Bustin' Down the Door
videos.description:
Watch or download the full movie from TheSurfNetwork.com at http://goo.gl/e50Xl

In the early 1970s, Australian chargers Mark Richards, Peter Townend, Ian Cairns, and Wayne "Rabbit" Bartholomew landed in Oahu with something to prove. Hawaii was seen as the center of the surfing universe and the brash Aussies sought to shake things up. Along with South Africans Shaun and Michael Tomson, the crew ripped apart legendary breaks like Pipeline and Waimea with radical innovations and bravery that bordered on insanity. Combining classic footage and revealing modern-day interviews, Bustin' Down the Door exposes the soul of this revolutionary period in a way few surf films can. The ground-breaking talents of MR and Co. are rightfully lauded for helping to build the concept of professional surfing, yet no excuses are offered for the reckless arrogance that helped ignite a powder keg of cultural pride on the North Shore. The self-promoting Australians were not shy about their talents, but by the time Cairns declared that "Aloha is dead" during the summer of '75, competitive banter had dangerously escalated beyond the waves. But what the group lacked in diplomacy, they made up for in determination, as their shared desire to be the best gave rise to a new era of surfing.

name: Isabel Letham
bio: Isabel Ramsay Letham was an Australian pioneer surfboard rider and swimming instructor, renowned as 'the first Australian to ride a surfboard'. A probably erroneous story has been repeated for years that on 10 January 1915 at Freshwater Beach, Sydney she experimented riding a board in the Hawaiian tradition in tandem with Duke Kahanamoku. This story has been disputed by researchers who have investigated its roots and provenance, and the reality is probably that she did not do so until shortly after, at Dee Why beach in Sydney, on 6 February 1915.

videos.title: Changing Tides in Ghana with Ishita Malaviya & Obibini Girls Surf Club
videos.description:
Earlier this year, Ishita Malaviya had the chance to travel to the small beach town of Busua in Ghana for a chance to surf with the incredible team at Obibini Girls Surf Club, the first Ghanaian surf girls, that are changing their community through their connection to the ocean. 

Much like Ishita‚Äôs own surf story, these girls are making waves, challenging existing cultural notions and inspiring others to join their ride.

In collaboration with Sea State
