videos.title: Surf Breaks | Gabriel Medina, Billy Kemper, Kai Lenny, Remembering Kobe Bryant, Paige Alms
videos.description:
GABRIEL MEDINA DOCUMENTARY
-Brazilian sports icon Gabriel Medina has a new film about his life story coming out at the end of the week. From seven-year-old grom to two-time World Champ, the film documents it all. If you're down in Brazil, catch the premiere on Friday, January 31, on GloboPlay.

NO SURFING FOR MOSTERT
- San Francisco 49ers' Raheem Mostert grew up living that beach life surfing and skating in Florida‚Ä¶We all know Florida has produced some surf legends -- Slater, the Hobgoods, Caroline Marks ‚Ä¶ take your pick. Bound for the Super Bowl in Miami on Sunday, Mostert's new contract prohibits him from participating in "extraordinary sports" such as surfing. Good luck on Sunday, Raheem, we'll catch one for ya.

MATAHI DROLLET FOILS PHANTOMS
-Seriously, who's having more fun on a foil these days than Matahi Drollet?Last week we saw him doing the Superman, race car and the yogi on his foil. Now he's taking it to the next level out at Phantoms on the North Shore. Thanks for keeping it fun, Matahi!

HAPPY BIRTHDAY STEPH GILMORE
-And finally, a very happy birthday to seven-time World Champion Stephanie Gilmore, who turns 32 today. Cheers! 
Hope you're having a rocking good day today, Steph!

SURFERS HONOR KOBE BRYANT
-The loss of NBA legend Kobe Bryant, his daughter, Gianna, and seven others in a tragic helicopter crash on Sunday morning stunned the world. Over the course of his 20 years and five championships with the Los Angeles Lakers, Bryant touched countless lives in unique and personal ways. He had a unique connection with USA Surfing and last year hosted the Olympic training team at his Mamba Sports Academy facility. Our thoughts and prayers are with the families, friends and fans at this time.

KEMPER WINS AT SUNSET
-Billy Kemper's win at Sunset was his second at the Open ‚Ä¶ And his win on the North Shore is another moment to remember for the Maui charger, who's had one heck of a winter‚Ä¶He won the cbdMD Jaws Big Wave Championships in December‚Ä¶Last week bagged what he called the wave of his life at Jaws...And now the win at Sunset‚Ä¶

CITY SURF BOOK
-Last week reported about the San Francisco 49ers' surfing running back, Raheem Mostert‚Ä¶And this week, as we look to the Super Bowl on Sunday, a new book called "City Surf" highlights a unique surf scene in the City By The Bay. Featuring the works of photographer Nathan Lawrence, it showcases the City Surf Project and the stories of some of San Francisco's unsung and underrepresented surfers. Go to learn more about the book go to CitySurfBook.com.

SUNDAY AT JAWS
-It's been a great start to 2020 out at Jaws, and the hits just kept on coming ‚Ä¶And it was Kai Lenny that ruled the day as another swell brought the north shore of Maui to life yet again on Sunday. Big and bumpy and windy, it was pretty much a tow affair with other standouts including Ian Walsh, Tyler Larronde and Jojo Roper.

SNEAK PEEK: PAIGE
-Another standout at Jaws on Sunday was Paige Alms, who is also the focus of a new documentary fittingly called "Paige."The film takes an in-depth look at one of the best big wave surfers in the world, as she trained mentally and physically for the 2017 Pe'ahi Challenge, which she won. You can catch a sneak peek of the film on WorldSurfLeague.com right now.

BWRAG TRAINING SCHEDULE
-And while we're on the subject of big waves, as a surfer, you never know when you're going to have to step in as a first responder in an emergency situation. To help everyone be more prepared, the Big Wave Risk Assessment Group has just announced its schedule for 2020 training summits. This year they're offering 14 summits around the world, with new locations added in Cape Hatteras and New Smyrna, Tofino, Casuarina Beach and Arica . Follow them on Instagram or check BWRAG.com to learn more.O'RIGINALS CONNOR LEE-And finally, Aussie mongrel Connor Lee is the focus of the latest episode of O'Neill's O'Riginals series. Hailing from Newcastle, he's a third-generation surfer looking to keep the family tradition alive and make big things happen in 2020. You can find the full video on O'Neill Australia's Vimeo channel.#WSL

videos.title: Women‚Äôs Pro Surfing Reunion Hosted by 1990 World Champion Pam Burridge
videos.description:
The Women‚Äôs Pro Surfing Reunion hosted by 1990 World Surfing Champion Pam Burridge is on Oct 14 - 21, 2018 S- Resorts, Bali‚Äôs Bukit Peninsula. Whether you were a fellow world champion, one of Pam‚Äôs contemporaries, a top 16 pro, judge, trialist or even just a female recreational surfer or fan, you are invited. There will be music, old photos, clips, dancing, storytelling --it will be such a blast.

If you are a female surfing fan this will be the chance of a lifetime to meet and hang out with the cream of women‚Äôs surfing. Pam doesn‚Äôt want anyone to be intimidated or feel left out, this social event is open to all girl surfers regardless of age.

To book or enquire, click here https://www.perfectwavetravel.com/surf-trips/bali/uluwatu-and-padang-padang/womens-pro-surfing-reunion-hosted-by-pam-burridge

videos.title: Freshies - Episode 3
videos.description:
Pam Burridge rides a foamie, a lot. When you run a surf school, it‚Äôs part of the territory.

But every now and then she feels the need to back up her quiver, and calls in the man of the house, life partner and renowned shaper Mark Rabbidge. Imagine that! You‚Äôre married to your shaper! It‚Äôs almost too much to contemplate, but with these two, life‚Äôs as simple as it needs to be. Come into the bay with Mark as he rips a clean little 5‚Äô8‚Äù semi fish Maldives holiday board out of the blank in one hour flat, while Pam gives him the odd gentle razzing from the doorway. Then check out the results in nice clean tropical lefts‚Ä¶and wait for the verdict.

More to come! Stay tuned for further episodes of Freshies.

Filmed by: Hannah Anderson
Handycam: Issi Rabbidge 
Director: Nick Carroll
Music: Sick Man's Blues - Peter Crosby & Crazy Like That - Lofive
Surfer: Pam Burridge

videos.title: Girls Can't Surf | An empowering history of badass women
videos.description:
An empowering history of badass women.

The untold story of how a band of renegade surfer girls in the 1980s fought to create their own professional sport, changing surf culture forever. It‚Äôs the 1980s and the world of professional surfing is a circus of fluoro colours, peroxide hair and radical male egos. GIRLS CAN‚ÄôT SURF follows the journey of a band of renegade surfers who took on the male-dominated professional surfing world to achieve equality and change the sport forever. Featuring surfing greats Jodie Cooper, Frieda Zamba, Pauline Menczer, Lisa Andersen, Pam Burridge, Wendy Botha, Layne Beachley and more, GIRLS CAN‚ÄôT SURF is a wild ride of clashing personalities, sexism, adventure and heartbreak, with each woman fighting against the odds to make their dreams of competing a reality.

DocPlay streams a curated collection of the world's most amazing and thought-provoking documentaries.

videos.title: 'Seas the Day' Women's Surf Festival
videos.description:
Surfing Australia's inaugural Seas the Day women's surf festival has been a huge hit.

About 12,000 people attended the event over two-days and more than 200 women and young girls hit the waves making Seas the Day the world‚Äôs biggest female participation surf event.

Highlights of the weekend included an excellent 9.0 ride from Surfing Australia Pathway Coach and 2005 World Champion Chelsea Hedges and a stellar performance from 1993 World Champion Pauline Menczer, who led her team to victory in the Celebrity Surf Challenge against 7x World Champion Layne Beachley, TV celebrities and Gold Coast Suns AFLW players.

Held at Kingscliff Beach, NSW on July 17 and 18, 2023 teams travelled from all over Australia to compete and a chance to nab major prizes.

Organisers plan to run the event annually.

videos.title: Girls Can't Surf | An empowering history of badass women
videos.description:
An empowering history of badass women.

The untold story of how a band of renegade surfer girls in the 1980s fought to create their own professional sport, changing surf culture forever. It‚Äôs the 1980s and the world of professional surfing is a circus of fluoro colours, peroxide hair and radical male egos. GIRLS CAN‚ÄôT SURF follows the journey of a band of renegade surfers who took on the male-dominated professional surfing world to achieve equality and change the sport forever. Featuring surfing greats Jodie Cooper, Frieda Zamba, Pauline Menczer, Lisa Andersen, Pam Burridge, Wendy Botha, Layne Beachley and more, GIRLS CAN‚ÄôT SURF is a wild ride of clashing personalities, sexism, adventure and heartbreak, with each woman fighting against the odds to make their dreams of competing a reality.

DocPlay streams a curated collection of the world's most amazing and thought-provoking documentaries.

Start streaming now on DocPlay: htttp://www.docplay.com

videos.title: EWSS3 Pauline Menczer + Kaia Parnaby Audio
videos.description:
Local Soroptimist Member Mona Sorensen interviews 2 Extraordinary Women in SPORT - both world champions & they both have had their fair share of making to the top rungs of the ladder, in a man's world. 
Join us for some incredible insight into their journeys.

Pauline Menczer is a Bondi girl who started surfing aged 12 in about 1982. 
She was a long-standing competitor on the world championship tour winning the following titles:
‚óè 1988 Women's Amateur World title, 
‚óè 1993 Women's World Championship
‚óè 2002 the WQS champion in 2002
In 1991 Menczer was only just narrowly beaten in the world championship by Wendy Botha, She was on tour & competing for 20 years & won a total of 20 WCT events & 8 WQS events; only one other surfer has won more. When Pauline Menczer won the 1993 women‚Äôs surfing world championship she was the only World Champion who did not receive any prize money or sponsorships for her feat & her trophy was broken.
Pauline grew up in Bondi with three siblings, but without her taxi-driver father when he was murdered. From age 14  & throughout her surfing career, Menczer suffered from sometimes crippling rheumatoid arthritis. Her friends sometimes has to push her around in a shopping trolley.
Since 2019 she has had a rare autoimmune disease that affects her skin. 
Ms Menczer said Bondi was a meaningful place for her.
‚ÄúI spent my entire childhood growing up on the beach in Bondi & Bronte with my brothers & it‚Äôs a very special place,‚Äù she said in a statement.
‚ÄúBondi has a huge part of my heart. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll always remember when one of my older twin brothers snapped his Coolite & I grabbed the other half & caught my first wave. ‚ÄúI was addicted from that moment.‚Äù
Ms Menczer‚Äôs story was recently featured in the documentary Girls Can‚Äôt Surf, which hit Australian cinemas in 2020.The film explores the history of female surfing & exposes the unfair treatment of women pros, who were often made to surf substandard waves & paid less than their male counterparts for their efforts.
Ms Menczer is seen in archive footage living out of a van &hustling to make ends meet during the peak of her professional career.
Her struggles, & that of other women to compete in a male dominated sport, is part of the movie Girls Can't Surf. The film explores the history of female surfing & exposes the unfair treatment of women pros, who were often made to surf substandard waves & paid less than their male counterparts for their efforts.

Kaia Parnaby (born July 14, 1990) is an Australian 2020 Olympian, left-handed professional softball pitcher, originally from Sydney, New South Wales.
She is a pitcher & earned a scholarship to & played for the Australian Institute of Sport.
Kaia was already dominant at junior national level, winning four Best Pitcher awards at U16 & U19 National Championships &another one in 2008 at U23 level.
She was part of Australia‚Äôs bronze medal winning team at the 2007 Junior Women‚Äôs World Championship & made her debut for the Aussie Spirit two years later at just 18 years of age, at the 2009 Canada Cup.
Kaia‚Äôs talent did not go unnoticed by US colleges, accepting a scholarship offer from the University of Hawaii in 2010. 
Her performances have seen Australia excel on the world stage.
Olympic Games:
Tokyo 2021
World Championships:
2018: XVI Women‚Äôs Softball World Championship, Chiba, Japan
2016: XV Women‚Äôs Softball World Championship, Surrey, Canada
2014: XIV Women‚Äôs Softball World Championship, Haarlem, Netherlands (bronze medal)
2012: XIII Women‚Äôs Softball World Championship, Yukon, Canada (bronze medal)
2010: XII Women‚Äôs Softball World Championship, Caracas, Venezuela
2007: VIII Jnr Women‚Äôs Softball World Championship, Enschede, Netherlands (bronze medal)
National Awards: 
2020: Best Pitcher, The Summer Slam ‚Äì Fully Loaded Softball
2017: Player of the Grand Final, Open Women‚Äôs National Softball Championship
2008, 2009: Best Pitcher, U19 Women‚Äôs National Softball Championship
Australian Championships
‚Ä¢ 11 national titles with New South Wales, including six Gilley‚Äôs Shield titles at open level. 
‚Ä¢ Currently playing in the Japan Women‚Äôs Softball League for seven seasons with the SGH Galaxy Stars. In her debut year in 2014 she struck out 67. In 2018 she ended second-best in the league striking out 98 opponents, - trailing US fireballer Monica Abbott.
‚Ä¢ In 2020 Kaia notched up her 500th career strikeout in the league, a phenomenal record.
‚Ä¢ Kaia played in the US National Pro Fastpitch league in 2017 with the Chicago Bandits & in 2018 & 2019 with the Australian team.
‚Ä¢ In 2019, Kaia was a part of the victorious Fury team at the inaugural Summer Slam ‚Äì Fully Loaded Softball, pitching the win in the grand final in Softball Australia‚Äôs newest form of the game.

videos.title: The Dangerous Surf Beach Biarritz | Massive Waves Drone View | New Aquitaine | France
videos.description:
The Dangerous Surf Beach Biarritz | Massive Waves Drone View | New Aquitaine | France 

#TravelEurope #Biarritz  #SurfBeach 

00:00 Intro
00:12 View over the beach
01:10 Rocher de la Vierge
01:47 Drone shots over waves

==Resources==
Get weekly travel tips from us straight to your inbox: 
‚û°Ô∏è https://sendfox.com/travelinpink ‚¨ÖÔ∏è

Biarritz‚Äôs six beaches offer plenty of variety. Some are perfect for swimming or surfing, others are ideal for families with small children. Situated on the Atlantic ocean these beaches are great for fun, relaxing and if you want to enjoy the beautiful nature. 
One of the most impressive Atlantic beaches in France. A famous place for surfers with big waves.

Biarritz is often referred to as a leading destination for leisure and water sports in southwest France. The spot offers six kilometers of waterfront and seven different beaches. 

Located on the Atlantic coast near the Spanish border in Biarritz, Grande Plage (or the Grand Beach) is the most popular and one of the most beautiful in town. 

Biarritz Beach: The Basics

The Grande Plage of Biarritz covers over 450m of fine sands and stands as the perfect surfing destination. On the promenade that extends along the beach, you can find exquisite seafood restaurants, a swimming pool, a casino, seawater therapy centers, and stunning Atlantic Ocean views. 

Biarritz is the capital of seawater therapy, also known among the locals as thalassotherapy. It‚Äôs a perfect place to relax with seawater massages, mud baths, seaweed wraps, or simply taking a long swim in the salty waters. Visitors can safely leave their children in kid‚Äôs clubs and enjoy the myriad watersports. 

A Hint of History

The beach is also known as Empress beach due to its royal background: back in the days, Napoleon III married princess Eug√©nie and built a summer residence for her on the beach. In 1893, the building was turned into what we know today as the H√¥tel de Palais, where you can still see some of the original furnishing and miraculous views. 

Biarritz was the favorite destination of the empress, and she loved spending her summers here. Many European royalties and cinema stars from both sides of the ocean also loved to come to Biarritz. 

Surfer‚Äôs Paradise

Biarritz and its Grande Plage are considered the birthplace of surfing in Europe. In September 1956, screenwriter Peter Viertel came to the town to film his movie ‚ÄúThe Sun Also Rises‚Äù, based on Hemingway‚Äôs novel. Film producer Richard Zanuck came with Viertel, and thus the story started. Zanuck was a passionate surfer and found out that Biarritz is a perfect surfing place.
We are Yuri and Julia, the travel couple, and we love exploring Europe.

bio:

Laine is considered to be one of the top, if not the best professional freestyle Jet Skiers to date.
In October 2008, Laine will be inducted into the IJSBA's Hall of Fame, where he will be honored for inventing many of the extreme aerial maneuvers used in freestyle jet ski competition today. The ceremony is to take place in Lake Havasu, at the conclusion of the IJSBA World Finals.

videos.title: KALANI CHAPMAN | BEST ONE EVER
videos.description:
This series, created in partnership with Inherent Bummer & World Surf League for the 2023 Billabong Pro Pipeline, is dedicated to those committed, skilled and fortunate enough to have caught ‚ÄúThe One‚Äù at the world‚Äôs most famous, most dangerous wave. In this episode, we learn about North Shore veteran Kalani Chapman‚Äôs pinnacle moment on a 9‚Äô6‚Äù shaped by his uncle Gary ‚ÄúOwl‚Äù Chapman. 

Video Credit: Water: Larry Haynes Photo Credit: Hank Foto
Athlete: https://www.instagram.com/kalooneytunes/
Creator: https://www.instagram.com/inherentbummer/

ABOUT THE SERIES:
We all have one ‚Äî that ride of a lifetime when everything comes together and becomes the personal benchmark for every wave ridden in the future. But when it comes to Pipeline, a ride like no other has a tendency take on a more significant meaning. For some: it‚Äôs life-changing. For others: borderline-spiritual. At the very least, it‚Äôs guaranteed to stay seared in their memory for eternity. On the eve of the 2023 Billabong Pro Pipeline, we‚Äôve created a series dedicated to those committed, skilled and fortunate enough to have caught ‚ÄúThe One‚Äù at the world‚Äôs most famous, most dangerous wave. And hoping this inspires a few more ‚ÄúBest Ones Ever‚Äù at this event and beyond.

videos.title: Surfer Rodrigo Koxa Breaks Record For Biggest Wave Ever Ridden
videos.description:
This is the incredible moment that Brazilian surfer Rodrigo Koxa broke the world record for riding the world's biggest wave ever ridden.

Koxa surfed an 80ft (24.4-metre) wave at Nazare in Portugal on 8 November 2017 and the moment was captured by Newsflare member Pedro Miranda.

Koxa's record for the highest wave ever surfed was confirmed at the 2018 Big Wave Awards that took place this weekend in Los Angeles.

videos.title: The Severson Files | Pacific Vibrations Part Ten (alternative soundtrack)
videos.description: Pacific Vibrations features Jock Sutherland, Bill Hamilton, Rolf Aurness, Merv Larson, Jeff Hakman, Mike Tabeling, Rick Griffin, Angie Reno, Brad McCual, Miki Dora, Chuck Dent, Steve Bigler, Greg Noll, Dale Velzy, Dewey Weber, Mike Purpus and more.

videos.title: The Severson Files | Pacific Vibrations Part Eight (alternative soundtrack)
videos.description: Pacific Vibrations features Jock Sutherland, Bill Hamilton, Rolf Aurness, Merv Larson, Jeff Hakman, Mike Tabeling, Rick Griffin, Angie Reno, Brad McCual, Miki Dora, Chuck Dent, Steve Bigler, Greg Noll, Dale Velzy, Dewey Weber, and Mike Purpus.

videos.title: THE SEVERSON FILES: Pacific Vibrations Part-1 (alternative soundtrack)
videos.description:
Once a week we dive into the video archives of filmmaker and SURFER Magazine founder John Severson. This week features the opening sequence of his final film ‚ÄúPacific Vibrations.‚Äù Released in 1970 and filmed during the transition era of board design, ‚ÄúPacific Vibrations‚Äù features a heavy amount of pintail single fins. More importantly, Severson‚Äôs inspiration for the film was to bring awareness to the changes he was witnessing happen to the ocean.

‚ÄúThis is a film that contrasts the beauty with the problems [environmental] and in the end makes a statement that would maybe prompt a few people to take action and start doing something,‚Äù Severson said about his film.

The visuals and art direction are what stand out most in the segment above. SURFER Magazine cartoonist Rick Griffin had returned to Southern California from the Bay Area and worked with Severson on the film. Watching the smooth line of a surfer‚Äôs psychedelic silhouette lead into a high-speed montage of photos, cartoons and everything surf-culture at the time is like traveling through a synapse of the pair‚Äôs surfed-out hive mind.

videos.title: A Two Wave Total - Profile: Sally Fitzgibbons
videos.description: A Two Wave Total follows Australia's leading female surfers as they chase glory on the Australian leg of the ASP Women's World Championship Tour. Stephanie Gilmore, Sally Fitzgibbons, Laura Enever, Tyler Wright, Rebecca Woods and junior star Nikki Van Dijk put it all on the line in front of their home fans at the Roxy Pro Gold Coast, Rip Curl Pro Bells Beach and Commonwealth Bank Beachley Classic in Sydney. A Two Wave Total follows their progress on the Dream Tour as they not only take on each other but the planet's best female surfers in their quest for surfing's ultimate honour -- the World Title.

videos.title: One Of The Toughest Performances Ever - Sally Fitzgibbons Wins ‚Äô15 Fiji With A Busted Ear!!
videos.description:
Sally Fitzgibbons blows out her eardrum in the early rounds of the 2015 Corona Fiji Pro, with the medical staff advising her to withdrawal from competition. Fitzgibbons channels her strength and bandages up to battle her way to a Fijian victory. Relive the journey. #wsl 

After a seven-year hiatus, Cloudbreak is back on the Championship Tour schedule as the ninth and final stop of the regular season. The 2024 Corona Fiji Pro presented by Bonsoy will see the top 24 men and 12 women return to one of the world's most perfect and iconic waves. This powerful, left-hand reef break will not only cap the regular season but will officially set the WSL Final 5 roster. 

Fiji has been home to some of the most memorable moments at the Championship Tour level, including a record four wins by 11x World Champion Kelly Slater who returns to the event this year as a wildcard. Fiji will also welcome back tour veterans such as Gabriel Medina, John John Florence, Tyler Wright, and Tatiana Weston-Webb as well as others who will be competing there for the first time including current world No. 1 Caitlin Simmers and Griffin Colapinto.

name: Shane Beschen
bio: Shane Beschen is a California (USA) born professional surfer.

videos.title: Shane Beschen, INDONESIA | SURFING and LIFE
videos.description:
NEVER BEFORE SEEN INTERVIEW and SURFING.  Shane Beschen has a refreshing outlook on surfing and life, and we wanted to share some of his quotes from the Op Pro Boat Trip Challenge 2000.  

"This trip is not like a real competition. It's way more of a let's all get better surfing trip.  I love that so much more than a straight- I win you lose type of competition because surfing's really not like that.   It's all about your freedom of how you want to paint your picture on the wave, really, and all of us do different paintings. It's great to learn lines from everybody; I think that's how everyone is treating this trip.  It's not really like we're here competing against each other. We're pushing each other to get better."

"I'd love to see all the potential world champions come together and create something new and entertaining for the people.  Let everyone know how radical surfing is and how incredible it is." 

"I tested out all the sports and really came to love surfing more than any of them just for the fact that it's not a team- it's up to you to decide how you want to surf and what kind of lines you want to draw on the wave and just all that type of freedom I guess I really learned to love." 

"Those are my favorite moments in surfing- just when the lip folds over you as your bottom turning or as you enter the air- everything stops, and it's kind of like going back to the birthplace of where we all came from."  -Shane Beschen.

Aloha, Shane. All the best to you and your family.  

#surfing #indonesia #surf

videos.title: Amavara & Shane Beschen : PROTECT WHAT YOU LOVE
videos.description:
There are few moments in life that truly shape one‚Äôs purpose.  For Shane Beschen, the birth of his oldest son Noah forever changed the lens through which he views the world.  

As a surfer and world tour standout, Shane‚Äôs unique approach to riding a wave kept us mesmerized for decades.  His desire to progress the sport helped shape the modern day format of competition that we all enjoy so much today.  It is this authenticity and uncompromising integrity that truly shines through in every aspect of his life.

All of these years later, we still find ourselves fascinated with the way the man articulates himself on the rails of his surfboard, tearing into the open face of a wave. We can still find him drawing lines today as he once did when he was on tour competing at the highest level of surfing. 
While his surfing prowess is to be admired, what inspires us most is the way he  carries himself as a father, a husband, a coach and  a mentor to us all.
 
Family quickly took center stage for the Beschen clan as they traveled on tour together.  The idea of being apart from his wife and child felt lonely and unfulfilling.  After the birth of their second son, Koda, his purpose shifted to being the best father he could be while continuing to pursue his passion for surfing. This transformation in Shane‚Äôs life instilled in him a new desire to share his innate talent as a surfer with both his family and the rest of the world.  In this new role of teacher, Shane found a new level of happiness. 
 
Raising his family  on the North Shore of Oahu, Shane understands the importance of protecting what he loves about Hawaii for future generations.  Hawaii has always been a leader in sustainability and conservation efforts, but a growing concern for environmental consciousness and respect is in the air. The Beschen boys are being raised to respect the waters in which they play and the land on which they live. 
 
Now with his sons Noah and Koda beginning surf careers of their own, dad finds himself in the coach‚Äôs corner.. Leading by example, Shane hopes to not only pass on the blueprint to becoming world-class surfers,, but to also show them how to beoutstanding citizens of this planet earth.  
Shane and Sofia are whole-heartedly content for the world to recognize their sons to be ‚Äúgood boys.‚Äù For them, no competitive success or accomplishment could ever match the pride of knowing that their children are a positive light in the world. The Beschen family  is a beautiful bunch and we invite you to have a look at this piece we made with them.. 
 
We are beyond proud to welcome the Beschens into the Amavara family.  This amazing group truly embodies the core values upon which Amavara‚Äôs foundation is built.  In life, the caliber of people with whom you surround yourself will surely determine the trajectory of your success.  
To leave this world, its people and our environment in a better condition than which it was found is our common philosophy.
 
Together and as individuals we have vowed to ‚ÄúProtect What We Love.‚Äù
 
Please stay tuned to this space for more from the Beschen‚Äôs.
We hope they inspire you, the same way they do us. 
 
We would like to extend a special thank you to the Beschen‚Äôs for having us in their home and for allowing us to create this little piece surrounding their family. We would also like to thank Parker Ellenburg for helping to bring this to life through his camera as well as Aaron Leiber and Brian Morrocco for your additional footage of Shane, Noah and Koda. 
 
Please enjoy

videos.title: GoPro Surfing Kings Of POV Team Moments Part 1 of 2: Shane Dorian + Anthony Walsh
videos.description:
Welcome to "Kings of P.O.V":

Two teams, four of the best tuberiders of the past decade, a favourable swell, GoPro HERO7s, a wave-rich stretch of coast, best P.O.V footage wins.

The first team consisted of the original hi-fi performer turned big wave lunatic Mr. Shane Dorian, and a GoPro aficionado with an almost unparalleled appetite for dense waves, Mr. Anthony Walsh. Shane had never been to the area, but was up at first light and straight out into a folding monster, despite being terrified of the prehensile beasts that lurk below in the area. Shane's fears were justified later in the trip, when after the duo upped anchor and jetted off from one of the reefs, a bloody great white breached right in the middle of the take-off zone, scaring the bejeezus out of the crew of bodyboarders who rule some of the heaviest waves in the area. 

Anthony Walsh is a man who we've seen endless amounts of surf footage of, but the man behind the ludicrous tuberiding remains more or less a mystery. Until now. We can confirm that A. Walsh is a teetotaler, pounds the java, was the first up every morning making the rest of the crew breakfast and checking the surf, can't sit still for five minutes - after a whole day in wetsuits when everyone else drank two beers and passed out, Walshy went squidding in the dark, and, most importantly, the guy will not stop surfing. All traits that are very hard to knock.

As an aside, as you marvel at the inner-most workings of some of the world's heaviest waves, just consider how far technology's come since we were first gifted visions from inside the green cathedral care of such pioneers as George Greenough. Dear George had a camera the size and weight of a microwave balanced on the front of his spoon, now, Dorian and the gang are lucky enough to be able to pull into tubes with cameras the smaller than the palm of your hand, then have them wonderfully stitched together by Robbie Crawford. Certified progress.

videos.title: The heaviest surf moments at Mavericks 2014
videos.description:
Get updated on Mavericks and other huge surf stories at http://win.gs/1alYVe2
On the biggest day of the winter, Mavericks lived up to its ferocious reputation and gave the best big-wave surfers in the world a contest deserving of their mettle and might.

Where do we begin.

Today, during the fourth and probably most anticipated event of the Big Wave World Tour, the waves, a chilly 18-20ft+ (up to 50ft faces), were persistent and giving. Massive, heaving bowls, tippy-toe air drops, a few 2-wave hold-downs, Jet Skis and inflatable vests were a prevalent sight as well.

That -- and a South African named Twiggy, who pretty much owned the entire day.

While in the early rounds, guys like last year's champ Peter Mel and Ryan Augenstein put on a clinic, flexing that local knowledge, the semis also had their share of epic battles.

While Greg Long dueled with Shaun Dollar, Mark Healey dueled with a set on the head, a perspective caught on his GoPro cam attached to his board -- which you NEED to watch on the site's heat analyzer. Truly unbelievable.
But then the final rolled around and the man with a heart like a Nor-Cal redwood with a nickname called Twiggy, stole the show, catching twice as many waves as the other five guys in the heat, including a gut-wrenching perfect 10.

Ross Williams said it best of the man, "Twiggy doesn't just go for broke, he also shows control, riding every wave all the way into the channel. But he's usually deepest too, of course."

Indeed he was. So deep on most in fact, that Twiggy was airdropping on his toes, then catching a heel-side rail, but regaining to push around the guillotine. Bawse-drops.

Although 2nd place Shane Dorian surely gave Baker a run for his money, also air-dropping into a few impossibly steep and rowdy bowls, Twigs prevailed, a man utterly possessed the entire event.

Said the sponsorless Twiggy Baker, "The prize money's great, but the thing is, even if none of us had sponsors or there was no event: we'd still all be out here today. We just love it." Amen, you maniac, you.

The Finals results go as follows:

1. Grant "Twiggy" Baker ‚Äî 29.33
2. Shane Dorian ‚Äî 25.532
3. Ryan Augenstein‚Äî 16.663
4. Tyler Fox ‚Äî 12.664
5. Greg Long ‚Äî 12.000
6. Anthony Tashnick ‚Äî 0.006

_________________________________

videos.description:
The concept was simple in theory: two teams of the world‚Äôs best GoPro operators, the endless tubes of the Australian desert, GoPro HERO7s, best clip wins. 

Shane Dorian and Anthony Walsh on one team, Ry Craike and Mikala Jones on the other. However, as anyone who‚Äôs ever tried to organise, well, anything, knows, simple concepts still take a mammoth effort to execute.

Welcome to the first part of Kings of POV (behind the scenes of a hunt for the wildest tube vision) starring Shane Dorian and Anthony Walsh.

Post production by Robbie Crawford.

videos.description:
The WSL Challenger Series is the pathway to pro surfing‚Äôs highest level. Across the six-event gauntlet, the sport‚Äôs most promising talents battle against former CT competitors to become one of the 10 men and five women who qualify for the Championship Tour and earn their place among the world‚Äôs best surfers.

videos.title: How to choose jetsurf leash, helmets, life jackets, life vests and drysuit ?
videos.description:
In this new short tips&tricks video I will show you how to properly choose a jetsurf leash, how to attach it to the board and common mistakes to avoid.
As a bonus tip, I will show you different types of summer and winter helmets, life jackets and life vests I am using and a dry suite that is perfect for cold winter rides. 

We will cover
- Choosing jetsurf leash, regular vs coiled leash
- 4 ways to attach the leash to jetsurf, pros and cons
- 2 types of jetsurfing helmets and what NOT to use
- Summer and winter life jackets and life vests I am using
- Dry suite that is perfect for cold winter rides (Ocean Rodeo Soul Classic)

The helmets I show are
- Jetsurf Helmet LAZER
- Scorpion Helmets for Motocross
- MET Parachute Helmet

The life jackets and life vests I am using
- The Ruthless molded vests by Jobe
- Jobe Neoprene Vest 
- O'Neill Slasher Comp Vest

I am NOT affiliated with any brands I mention. It's 100% honest opinion.

A lot of things I cover might look simple and obvious for jetsurf experts and veterans, but could be very helpful for people who are just starting out with jet surfing and have no experience in it! 

As usual, big thanks to Luis for helping me with filming this and Wayne Brooks from Jetboard Limited and Jeff Scott from Sussex installations and Thomas and Vaclav from Jetsurf Factory for consulting me about the technical part and giving me valuable advice on the board maintenance. 

===========================

Enjoying my videos? Join me on my mission to spread the word about this exciting new sport of Jet surfing

My main blog with news and updates about jet surfing and artificial waves 
Surfing Nation: Make Your Waves http://jetsurfingnation.com/

The new exciting sport is evolving and together, 
we can be on the edge of the new next generation surfing technology to test electric jet boards

videos.title: BEST EVER BELLS BEACH: Simon Anderson's GAME CHANGING win in 1981
videos.description:
Join us as we dive into the historic moment on April 18, 1981, when Simon Anderson revolutionized surfing at the IPS ASP WSL Rip Curl Pro Easter Classic with his groundbreaking three fin thruster design. Experience the chaos of 'Big Saturday' as fifteen-foot waves crashed at Bells Beach, creating an unforgettable spectacle for competitors and spectators alike. Discover how this iconic event reshaped surfboard design and left an indelible mark on surfing history.

videos.title: Surfing with the FIRST Female SURFER to Represent America Samoa
videos.description:
I recently visited Hawaii, and during my time there I spent the day with Lucy Jarrard, the first female surfer to represent America Samoa in the International Surfing Association, who is competing in an Olympic Qualifier in El Salvador. When a surfer gains enough points from this series, they move their way up to the highest level of professional surfing. This qualifying series will qualify Lucy for the World Championship Tour (WCT)!

In this video, Lucy shares her story and passion for surfing, and takes us to the Mermaid Caves for cliff jumping and surfing in Waikiki in Oahu, Hawaii. It was incredible experiencing the island of Hawaii from her eyes and hearing how her ocean-loving family played a pivotal role in her surfing background.

If you'd like to support Lucy's dreams in her surfing journey, you can donate to her GoFundMe! Your support and contributions make it possible for her to surf for American Samoa. Your donations will go directly to training, food and lodging, surf equipment, and further travel expenses for contests.
https://www.gofundme.com/f/Help-Lucy-be-the-first-female-to-represent-AS

I hope you enjoy this travel video to Hawaii and Lucy's story!

Follow Lucy on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/Lucyjarrard/
Check out her website and learn more about her: https://lucyjarrard.com/

videos.title: Sprinters Fighting For It üòÖ
Counting Down the 10 Best Surf Clips of September
videos.description:
While it‚Äôs nearly November, we've finally ranked and edited the top-10 best surf clips released online in September. Better late than never, right? 30 days of full-length edits and ADD-inducing Instagram clips boiled down to the best 10 waves, taking up a whopping 2:29 seconds. A time capsule of high-performance surfing, if you will.

Including footage from Panama, Africa, West Oz, Indonesia, California and beyond, September‚Äôs edition of COTM is packed with eight barrels, two airs, and loads of stylish surfing. While Nic Von Rupp‚Äôs triple section Desert Point drainer in about three inches of water takes top honors, it was a tough call, as Mitch Parkinson‚Äôs tweaked frontside full rotation, and Jack Robinson‚Äôs West Oz double pit could just as easily have won the month.

#1: Nic Von Rupp | Indonesia
Filmed by: Mendo Dornellas

videos.title: Soleil Errico - The New WSL Longboard World Champion, Talks Winning 2nd World Title | The Lineup
videos.description:
Freshly crowned Longboard World Champion Soleil Errico joins The Lineup to discuss winning her second World Title. She talks about winning at her home break, how wild it is to surf flawless Malibu with no one else out, the difference between this title and her first one in 2018, and her shifting strategy throughout the event. She breaks down the biggest heats along her road to the title, the boards she was riding and how she sources her equipment, and her goals for the 2023 Longboard Tour and beyond. She looks back at her journey to becoming a longboard champ, being born in New York City, moving to Hawaii and California and starting to surf First Point Malibu all the time, her greatest surfing influences over the years, and the moment she knew she wanted to be a professional surfer. Soleil also touches on balancing college with traveling to compete, working with young surfers through the Rising Tides program, and the wave she wants to surf most. 

For More Check Out:
Heat Of The Year?! Soleil Errico vs Alice Lemoigne | Cuervo Classic Malibu Longboard Championship - https://youtu.be/n1ADhjG1l10

videos.title: Alternative Lines: The Faces of Women's Longboarding in 2018
videos.description:
SURFER presents "Alternative Lines: The Faces of Women's Longboarding in 2018." It was at this point, last year, that social feeds worldwide started to become filled with a steady stream of beautiful longboarding. Fresh clips of world longboarding champion Honolua Bloomfield, along with Kelia Moniz, Natalia Smith, Rosie Jaffurs, Victoria Vergara, Justine Mauvin, and Soleil Errico, seemed to pop up digitally overnight. The driving force behind this influx was most likely Roxy Facer (or @Roxface, as she's known on Instagram).

This is a short edit filmed with some of her favorite moments from the last year, all cut to the fresh sounds of another female creative, Leanne Curren. Enjoy.

videos.title: 2022 Cuervo Classic Malibu Longboard Championship | Day 1 Highlights
videos.description:
Current World No. 1 Kaniela Stewart (HAW) demonstrated that he is up for the task of holding off his opponents as he earned an excellent 8.00 (out of a possible 10) debut score in his chase for a maiden World Title.

Stewart‚Äôs effortless approach of beautiful noserides, footwork, and rail work garnered him the day‚Äôs best 8.67 and 16.87 heat total against former WSL Longboard Champion Steven Sawyer (RSA) and fellow World Title contender Kaimana Takayama (USA). 

‚ÄúIt feels super good to be back here at Malibu,‚Äù said Stewart.

"The waves are fun, a little slow, but as they pick up, it‚Äôll get super fun. I‚Äôve been training a bunch at DNA Performance with Bryce and working on a bunch of cardio, strength, endurance, and fatigue."

Fellow World No. 1, and reigning WSL Longboard World Champion, Honolua Blomfield (HAW) put on a world-class showcase of her own to debut.

Blomfield‚Äôs undeniable style on the nose and seamless transitions garnered her a 14.10 two-wave total in the Seeding Round before another 16.47 heat total in the Round of 16. The 23-year-old inches closer to pushing her own piece of history further as she chases her fourth World Title.

‚ÄúThe whole heat, I felt like I was just catching waves and having a blast,‚Äù said Blomfield.

‚ÄúI borrowed my friend‚Äôs board and liked it so much she sold it to me (laughs). I love the board I‚Äôm on, and the waves are so fun, and I‚Äôm very excited for tomorrow.‚Äù

Blomfield‚Äôs fellow World Title contender Kelis Kaleopa‚Äôa (HAW) also shined in both of her opening day heats as she styled her way directly into Round 3. Kaleopa‚Äôa is in her second consecutive World Title race and is looking for redemption and to take home her first World Title.

Current World No. 2‚Äôs Harrison Roach (AUS) and Taylor Jensen (USA) both earned their respective spots into Finals Day after masterful Seeding Round performances.

A last-minute opportunity for Roach gave him the edge for the win in a nail-biting affair featuring 2019 WSL Longboard Champion Justin Quintal (USA) and Hawaii‚Äôs Keoki Saguibo. 

‚ÄúI knew that when waves like that come through, they‚Äôre really worthwhile and to make the most out of them,‚Äù said Roach.

‚ÄúI was riding one of my models last year, and I felt like I was surfing my best but couldn‚Äôt get out of the high seven-point-ride range. They were looking for more hang-tens, and so I changed my equipment to give them that.‚Äù

World Title contenders, former WSL Longboard Champions Rachael Tilly (USA) and Soleil Errico (USA), both advanced in brilliant form.

Malibu‚Äôs own, Errico, kicked off her morning with a big heat win before matching up with Maria Fernanda Reyes (PER) in their duel as the Californian posted a jaw-dropping 16.90 heat total (out of a possible 20), including a day‚Äôs best 8.67 (out of a possible 10). 

‚ÄúAfter twenty minutes of not getting a wave, I was just thinking, ‚ÄòThis is not happening right now,‚Äù said Errico.

‚ÄúI just needed an opportunity, and then, thank God, a couple of sets came in. In my heart, I knew they were going to come, every other heat had sets prior. It was super stressful, but I made it out.‚Äù 

Prominent World Title contender Ben Skinner (GBR) also debuted with an excellent 8.00, with WSL Longboard Tour newcomer Tosh Tudor (USA) advancing over veteran Tony Silvagni (USA).

Tudor showed full control while perched on the nose through critical sections of the wave and now looks to find his way to the Final here at Malibu.

Kai Sallas (HAW) also kept on pace to continue his search for a maiden World Title with a clutch debut win.

A heart-racing moment for World Title contender Chloe Calmon (BRA) nearly witnessed the multiple Title runner-up face elimination, but a critical 7.10 turned the tide for her in the dying minutes against an in-form Sally Cohen (HAW).

Potential Spoilers Begin to Make Their Moves

A showdown of World Title spoilers unfolded in men's Seeding Round 1, Heat 5, featuring Longboard Tour veterans Kevin Skvarna (USA) and Taka Inoue (JPN) taking on newcomer Declan Wyton (AUS).

A flurry of opportunities pushed into First Point to offer a spectacle of world-class longboarding from each of the competitors, all posting 14-plus point heat totals, but it was Australia‚Äôs Wyton who stole the win with a 15.17.

‚ÄúIt was firing out there in my heat,‚Äù said Wyton.

‚ÄúIt was a bit of a slow morning, but I‚Äôm gassed now. It was non-stop out there. At the moment, the tide is really perfect, and the wave has a good pace on it, and it was easy to connect them through."

Also, 2021 Cuervo Surf Ranch Classic winner and 2021 World Title contender Edouard Delpero (FRA) took over his opening heat against three-time WSL Longboard Champion Jensen and Peru‚Äôs Lucas Garrido Lecca. The Frenchman started the match with a brilliant 7.50 and 6.53 to eclipse his opponents' opening rides. 

While the top women held their ground, Mason Schremmer (USA) took down World Title contender Kaitlin Mikkelsen (USA) in their stout, Round of 16 battle.

videos.title: What happened when I fall #surf #surfing #athlete #waves #surfers #skate #wsl #fit
Qualified Challengers Confidence On Full Display, Plus Shocking Upsets | Post Show Day 2
videos.description:
Day 2 of the Corona Saquarema Pro was an emotional roller coaster. Already qualified surfers Rio Waida and Leonardo Fioravanti display next-level confidence. Willian Cardoso fought back tears to surf another day of Challenger action. Sophia Medina, sister to Gabriel Medina, showed up and took her first heat win on the challenger. Heavy wipeouts, crucial jet ski rescues plus crazy priority interferences capped off a wild day at Itauna.

Only two events remain in the battle for Championship Tour qualification. With three surfers already locking up their place on the 2023 tour, seven men's and five women‚Äôs spots are still up for grabs when the best up-and-coming surfers head to Brazil. Watch the Corona Saquarema Pro presented by Banco Do Brasil live November 1-8 on worldsurfleague.com

Saquarema will give the top Challenger Series surfers a true test. As they near Championship Tour qualification, they‚Äôll have to prove their skills against their future competitors in a heat draw featuring Gabriel Medina, Samuel Pupo, Jadson Andre, and more.

The Championship Tour‚Äôs second half moves from one dream destination to the next. At their first-ever event in El Salvador, the competitors will be treated to a world-class, rippable right pointbreak. videos.title: Swell Down Upside - Uluwatu, 19 September 2020
videos.description:
After a few weeks of relentless swell and solid to very large Uluwatu, there was a finally a change of pace at Bali's premiere swell magnet on the 19th of September.

If feels like quite a while since we've had anything in the head high range here, and with a draining afternoon tide, the medium sized swell produced plenty of fun walls with the odd head-dip thrown in for good measure.

name: Tatiana Weston-Webb
bio: Tatiana Guimar√£es Weston-Webb, also known as Tati Weston-Webb or just Tati, is a Brazilian surfer based in Kauai, Hawaii. She is also both American and English. She was the only rookie on the professional surfing World Championship Tour in 2015. Weston-Webb wears jersey number 9, and her 2016 'CT rank is number 4. She competed in both the 2020 and 2024 Summer Olympics for Brazil, winning silver in the latter and because of that she became the first woman surfer from Brazil to win a medal at the Olympics.

videos.title: Battle for the Breasts: Tatiana Weston-Webb Quarterfinal
videos.description:
Tatiana Weston-Webb surfs against Dimity Stoyle for the fight against Breast Cancer. Go vote for Tatiana on Surfline.com here: http://goo.gl/z19rMf

During the month of October, 16 top female surfers representing their respective cancer clinics will be seeded head-to-head in a four-round bracket. Surfline's users will vote each week based on who's surfing is the best. And the top vote-getters will progress through the draw each week throughout Breast Cancer Awareness Month.

THE PRIZE MONEY
First Place: $50,000
Second Place: $30,000
Equal-Third Place: $10,000, $10,000
Remaining 12 clinics: $2,500
(Clinics will receive diagnostic testing vouchers in the above amounts from Ambry Genetics.)

videos.title: Dropping In with Tatiana Weston-Webb
videos.description:
Tatiana Weston-Webb can easily be mistaken for Daenerys Targaryen, the blonde-haired Mother of Dragons from Game of Thrones. She‚Äôs been an intimidating force on the women‚Äôs Championship Tour since her full time arrival in 2015, when she opened with a third place finish at Snapper, made the finals in France, clinched the Qualifying Series, finished No. 7 on the CT leaderboard, and was named Rookie of the Year. Her competitive drive comes from her Brazilian mother, a former professional bodyboarder who won an event at Pipeline in the 90s. Her passion comes from dad, a hardcore surfer from Kauai. Her high-energy approach is a direct reflection of her personality, void of any timidity, and equally dangerous at ten-foot Cloudbreak as it is at three-foot Huntington Beach. In 2016 she nabbed her first CT win at the Vans US Open of Surfing. And in 2017 she made back-to-back finals in Fiji and HB. In 2018 she‚Äôll be traveling with her longtime boyfriend, Jesse Mendes, a rookie on the men‚Äôs Tour. And you can bet pro surfing‚Äôs new power couple has eyes on that throne.
Follow Tatiana at @Tatiwest and check her out on this year's Championship Tour at WorldSurfleague.com, the WSL App, and Facebook Live.

#WSL

name: Taylor Jensen
bio: Taylor Jensen is an American professional longboard surfrider.

videos.title: Top 5 Moments Of The Vans US Open Of Surfing & Vans Duct Tape Invitational
videos.description:
Stillhouse presents Top 5 Moments Of The Vans US Open Of Surfing & Vans Duct Tape Invitational. Eithan Osborne throws a massive full rotation for the highest single wave score of the event (9.67) Kelis Kaleopaa takes down current world no.1 to make her presence known on the Longboard Tour, while Taylor Jensen enters the World Title chat. Bettylou Sakura Johnson displays critical rail work to take home her first Challenger Series win, and Ezekial Lau takes to the air to put his name in the US Open history books.

The Vans US Open and Vans Duct Tape Invitaional is done and dusted. What a marathon of 9 days in the shadow of the HB Pier that saw Sakura Johnson and Lau take critical wins at the halfway mark of the Challenger Series season in their mission to join the Championship Tour and WSL Longboard Tour tighten the World Title race with Kaleopa‚Äôa and Jensen emerging victorious.

videos.title: Taylor Jensen and The Blind Surfer - TRAILER
videos.description:
Get a sneak peek at this episode where 3x World Longboarding champ Taylor Jensen stops by to see if he can change Pete‚Äôs opinion about longboarding.  See the full eppisode here: https://youtu.be/oJa0reMnNKE 

IG @RealPeteGustin
www.BlindSurfer.com
www.petegustin.com 

If you have any interest at all in what you just saw and you‚Äôd like to learn more, we HIGHLY recommend watching the Blind Surfer documentary called ‚ÄúFinding A Way ‚Äì The Story of the Blind Surfer‚Äù.  This 26 minute piece will bring a whole new perspective to everything you watch on this channel.
https://youtu.be/8pD_9Ym6k70 


Here‚Äôs a little more on Pete along with some FAQ‚Äôs

Pete was diagnosed at the age of 8 with macular degeneration. The disease would later be renamed as Stargadt's because it affected Pete so young and needed to be reclassified. Pete was born with perfect eyesight, but the genetic disorder began to eat away at his eyesight from the moment of his birth rendering him legally blind by the age of 8 and without any "functional" eyesight by his mid-30's. 
Q: is Pete's eyesight completely black? 
A: No. Pete sees a jumble of light and dark. There are no distinct shapes and this "non-functional" eyesight makes it impossible to process the information his eyes are sending to his brain. Clicking on the following episode will show you a number of visual examples of how Pete sees: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xU8YdjpsbsI&feature=youtu.be 

Q: How is Pete reading and responding to these comments? 
A: Pete does not read comments. Pete does not "read" anything. He uses Text to Speech technology and the Voice Over feature on his iPhone.  You can see an entertaining 58 second demonstration here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=54ZjDAUi3Sc&feature=youtu.be

Q: why does it look like he's looking at the camera? 
A: The camera looks at Pete. He does not look at the camera unless he has been given a "mark" or is following a predetermined and pre-discussed route of the camera. Please refer to the start of this episode for more: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7g6M2VbtW1k&t=1s 

Q: can Pete type? 
A: yes. Pete has fingers. Pete can type. Pete also uses the dictate feature on his phone just like millions of Americans who like to dictate faster than they can type. 

Q: How does Pete get around? 
A: Pete gets around with the help of a cane, his guide dog Superdog and his friends. When you see him on camera, many routes have been pre-plotted for the ease of viewing. To see how Pete gets to his spot on the beach, please check out the 48 second mark of this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4HZ9_Hc2Ums&feature=youtu.be 

Q: Why does Pete have eyes? 
A: being blind does not mean that you don't have eyes. It just means that they don't' work 

Q: So why is he looking at stuff when he talks? 
A: Pete's ears work fine so he can hear where voices are coming from and looks in the direction of those voices. 

Q: Why is Pete wearing sunglasses 
A: Most blind people wear sunglasses because they make really poor eye contact and it‚Äôs a little off-putting to people in the sighted world to be looking at someone who isn‚Äôt really looking back. Also, since Pete‚Äôs eyes can‚Äôt regulate the amount of light coming into his pupils, direct exposure to bright sunlight can cause pretty un-fun headaches so he keeps the shades on to keep the unregulated and indistinct bright light out. 

If you have any other questions, please feel free to ask in the comments. The Blind Surfer channel is always happy to help spread awareness and information about blindness and how it affects tens of millions of people worldwide.

videos.title: Always an Angel‚Ä¶.never a god #edit #rockfam #rockfamily #rs #rocksquad #ria #rocksquad #blowup
SLOW WITH ZO√â GROSPIRON
videos.description:
Ah time! Our dear time, what a pleasure to be talking about you. You who decides of everything, who regulates our day and our life, and, at some point, who defines what is fast and what is, by opposition, slow. Zo√© is definitely fast, running around all day, never losing a second. I, on the contrary, can be considered as slow. My life is basically slow in the morning and not too fast in the afternoon which is funny because you manage to see things differently.

Take a camera for example. Its speed determine how much time its sensor will have to print everything it sees on a card or a film. Set it up on a high shutter speed, at around 1/2000 sec, it will only show you what happens in this timeframe as it will assemble into an image. Less data equals sharp images.
Now, set it up on a low speed, at around 10 sec. With A LOT more data to assemble, it will first take time to process (I told you it was slow...) and then you will end up with a very blurry outcome. No perfect recollection of what happened, but a special interpretation, giving you, more or less, only a vibe of the moment.

And now, welcome to my slow life, where everything is a blur!

With that in mind, and our life being so fast, everyone trying their best to do more and fit the most into their day, I thought it was time to sit down and enjoy the moment. Having Zo√© as a muse was obvious, as she has always been open to new ideas, really motivated, curious and a really smooth and talented longboarder. I also thought mixing someone fast with something slow could be interesting.

And with all that reading, you still don't know what it's about... Don't worry, I'll get to it! So, initially, with this project, I wanted to slow things down (not her surfing though), and focus on things we don't normally have time to focus on. Take gliding for example. How is gliding on a longboard different? How does it feel? What is the best feeling Zo√© can get? Hard questions to answer with words as we don't take time to reflect on them. "Dance", "approach", "elegance", "flying", "addictive", and  "art" came into the discussion which, as you understood, does not focus on surf performance.

To emphasize my point about slow, I decided to shoot Zoe‚Äôs fast surfing with a slow shutter speed, gathering the best moments of our discussion with the best images. All of this topped by a music specially composed to suit her surfing, her style and her feelings. The outcome is about putting the original vibes of surfing into the main focal point, with a slow edit all about the vibes of Zo√© Grospiron's surfing.

videos.title: 2024 ISA World Junior Surfing Championship | Final Highlights
videos.description:
An incredible finals day capped off the 2024 Surf City El Salvador ISA World Junior Surfing Championship (WJSC) where Australia, the winningest team in ISA World Junior history, broke a drought of 11 years to take one of the most commanding victories seen in ISA competition.

Individual gold medals for Dane Henry and Ziggy Mackenzie were backed up by a silver medal for Fletcher Kelleher and copper for Milla Brown.

But the performance of their entire team was so strong that victory was almost secured before finals day even began.

The conditions were near-perfect for World Champions to be crowned.

Clean, four-to-six-foot peaks at La Bocana made the entire lineup look like a playground, and with the wind holding off, Surf City El Salvador delivered endless opportunities for the world‚Äôs best junior surfers to earn their historic wins.

Not only did Australia as a team break a long gap in victory, but Dane Henry (AUS) became the first Australian to win Boy‚Äôs U/18 in 15 years.

Though Henry‚Äôs performances all week were the talk of the event, most notably the only Perfect 10 of the competition, a lull in waves during the Main Event Final saw him sent to the Repechage Final after only putting a single score on the board.

Learning his lesson, the 17-year-old stayed active in his next two heats, catching more waves than anyone in both, capped off by a 9.23 in the Grand Final.

‚ÄúThis is the best moment of my life,‚Äù Henry said.

‚ÄúBefore the Semis we heard that we got the gold and got the official confirmation and we did a big ring of fire. It‚Äôs just all come together after 10 years of us not winning gold. I just can‚Äôt believe it. I‚Äôm lost for words."

Ziggy Mackenzie‚Äôs (AUS) road to the Final was made smoother after she took a wave in her Girl‚Äôs U/16 Main Event Final with one second to go.

Needing a 6.54, the 15-year-old grabbed a 6.57 to guarantee herself a medal.

In an extremely tight final, a 6.83 from Mackenzie proved to be the high point and when her backup of a 5.93 arrived late in the heat, it was enough to seal the deal and plant her name as a World Junior Champion alongside fellow Australians Stephanie Gilmore and Tyler Wright.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm so stoked, Mackenzie said.

‚ÄúI feel like all the work that I‚Äôve put in and all the support from the Australian team has all come together. I think everyone was so excited but so nervous at the same time coming into this event. We‚Äôve got such a strong team, and we really wanted to just push and push as hard as we can. We‚Äôre on top, and I‚Äôm so stoked for the team.‚Äù

Spain‚Äôs Dylan Donegan backed up teammate Hans Odriozola‚Äôs 2023 gold medal when he became U/16 World Champion.

Both Donegan and Odriozola claimed their wins over Lukas Skinner (ENG), who once again won the silver medal.

Donegan won each of his seven heats surfed this week, flaring most when it counted.

An 8.17 for a backhand two-turn combo that featured a critical second closeout hit was backed up by a 7.13 for a 15.30 heat total.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm really, really happy,‚Äù Donegan said.

‚ÄúIt feels amazing. Just to even qualify for the team in Spain is really, really hard. I haven‚Äôt put it in my mind yet, I guess I‚Äôm going to have to and enjoy the moment and when it‚Äôs on me I‚Äôll just probably go crazy.‚Äù

An impassioned performance from Thiago Passeri saw the Argentinian win the first Boy‚Äôs U/16 medal for his nation, the bronze, while the first New Zealand boy to win a medal since 2007, Alexis Owen (NZL), notched his name alongside Ricardo Christie and Matt Hewitt.

Hawaiian girls account for the most gold medals in the WJSC, and Vaihiti Inso continued that tradition when she won the 11th gold medal for Hawaii.

The new U/18 World Champion was proud to represent her team and her culture with the victory, but was also thrilled to display a solid show of surfing.

Winning the Grand Final with an 8.50 and 8.17, largely on the strength of her powerful and stylish forehand carves on the lefts of La Bocana, her 16.67 heat total left her fellow finalists in need of near-perfection to reach her.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm almost speechless,‚Äù Inso said.

‚ÄúHonestly my main goal was not the result but just to put on a good performance and I hope I did that. I love surfing and before there was no lefts and all of a sudden the lefts just came that way. So mahalo ke Akua for the waves and God for everything.‚Äù

2024 Surf City El Salvador ISA World Junior Surfing Championship | Results

Team Rankings

Gold - Australia
Silver - Hawaii
Bronze - France
Copper - USA

Boy‚Äôs U/16

Gold - Dylan Donegan (ESP)

videos.title: Highlights Day 3 | Tyler Wright Drops Highest Wave Score Of The Day
videos.description:
With the field reduced, Tyler Wright is looking to ring the Bell for the first time in her career. 

Bells Beach means history and heritage for both surfing and Australia. As the longest-running event on tour, it is a proving ground - an unforgiving lineup that tests the endurance, power, and fundamental rail-to-rail surfing of today‚Äôs progressive athletes. The deep sense of history that echoes through the Bells bowl, combined with the pressure of the fast-approaching Mid-season Cut, makes getting a win and ringing ‚ÄúThe Bell‚Äù one of the greatest honors in the sport.

Watch live April 10-20

videos.title: Battle for the Breasts: Tyler Wright Round 1
videos.description:
Tyler Wright surfs against Tatiana Weston-Webb for the fight against Breast Cancer. Go vote for Tyler on Surfline.com here: http://goo.gl/WwEqLU

During the month of October, 16 top female surfers representing their respective cancer clinics will be seeded head-to-head in a four-round bracket. Surfline's users will vote each week based on who's surfing is the best. And the top vote-getters will progress through the draw each week throughout Breast Cancer Awareness Month.

THE PRIZE MONEY
First Place: $50,000
Second Place: $30,000
Equal-Third Place: $10,000, $10,000
Remaining 12 clinics: $2,500
(Clinics will receive diagnostic testing vouchers in the above amounts from Ambry Genetics.)

videos.title: Tyler Wright's 9.57 in Epic Round Three Clash - Drug Aware Margaret River Pro 2017 (W)
videos.description:
Tyler Wright, Malia Manuel and Sage Erickson delivered the most entertaining heat of the day during their Round Three match. While all three surfed well it ultimately became a slugfest between Manuel and Wright. Manuel opened strong, and held the lead for most of the heat with her inspired surfing, looking every bit the contender she is. But Wright came clawing back the way World Champs do. She unleashed on this racy right that earned her a 9.57. Malia wasn't done though. She fired back with a 9.00 of her own. Then, in the closing moments Tyler overtook the Hawaiian for good with an 8.37.

videos.title: JAGGER BARTHOLOMEW
videos.description: Jagger Bartholomew airs over me at Snapper Rocks.

videos.title: Wayne (Rabbit) Bartholemew
videos.description:
Ian Freestone talks with Surfing World Champ (and 2x Masters Champion), Wayne "Rabbit" Batholomew. As a young, Gold Coast "Coolie" kid,  Rabbit had a dream of earning a living from surfing and becoming world champion. Runner up to Shaun Thomson in 1977, Rabbit would finally achieve his dream in 1978. Featured in movies, "Free Ride" and "Bustin' Down the Door", Rabbit was at the vanguard of pioneering the development of surfing as a professional worldwide sport and the visionary for the current 'Dream Tour' - putting the best surfers in the best waves on the planet. Now in his 60s, Rabbit remains a passionate dreamer who makes things happen.

name: Wendy Botha
bio:
Wendy Botha is a four-time world surfing champion. She won her first title as a South African citizen in 1987, then she became an Australian citizen and won three more titles in 1989, 1991, and 1992. She also posed nude for Australian Playboy for the September issue of 1992. 
Botha married New Zealand rugby league international and television star Brent Todd in 1993.
They had two children, Jessica and Ethan, and split in about 2005.

videos.title: Girls Can't Surf | An empowering history of badass women
videos.description:
An empowering history of badass women.

The untold story of how a band of renegade surfer girls in the 1980s fought to create their own professional sport, changing surf culture forever. It‚Äôs the 1980s and the world of professional surfing is a circus of fluoro colours, peroxide hair and radical male egos. GIRLS CAN‚ÄôT SURF follows the journey of a band of renegade surfers who took on the male-dominated professional surfing world to achieve equality and change the sport forever. Featuring surfing greats Jodie Cooper, Frieda Zamba, Pauline Menczer, Lisa Andersen, Pam Burridge, Wendy Botha, Layne Beachley and more, GIRLS CAN‚ÄôT SURF is a wild ride of clashing personalities, sexism, adventure and heartbreak, with each woman fighting against the odds to make their dreams of competing a reality.

DocPlay streams a curated collection of the world's most amazing and thought-provoking documentaries.

videos.title: Day of the Year at Dungeons | Inside Africa‚Äôs most terrifying big wave break
videos.description:
Nestled at the foot of the Sentinel on the tip of southern Africa, Dungeons is arguably the scariest, most challenging big wave spot in the world, according to three times Big Wave World Champ and XXL Big Wave Award winner, Grant Twiggy Baker.
TURN & GO takes you into the line-up and peels back the layers on this mythical surf spot, set against highlight sessions from 2023. Along the way we get some candid insight into the world champ‚Äôs drive to keep charging the biggest waves on the planet.

She has also provisionally qualified for the 2020 Olympic Games. Congratulations Carissa!

videos.title: Carissa Moore: A Decade in Pictures (2009-2019) | 10 Years, 4 World Surfing Titles
videos.description:
Watch the career highlights of Carissa Moore between 2009-2019.

In this decade, she became the best competitive Hawaiian surfer of all time after winning her fourth world title.

"That was crazy, and I was trying to keep my focus and emotions in check," said Moore.

"This is incredible! It's been years of work and years of growing and learning. It's been a journey, and I've been really looking forward to this moment, but it hasn't sunk in yet. So many of my family and friends are here, and I'm so excited to share this with them."

By clinching a fourth WSL Title, the 27-year-old from Honolulu joins the likes of Lisa Andersen (USA), Wendy Botha (ZAF) and Freida Zamba (USA), Layne Beachley (AUS), and Stephanie Gilmore (AUS), further cementing her name in professional surfing's history books.

Moore also becomes Hawaii's most-successful surfer ever on the world stage, surpassing Andy Irons' three world titles and John John Florence's two titles.

"I dreamed of this moment for a long time," continued Moore.

"Each world title has been a little different, and this one was definitely the hardest. Being in the title race with Caroline and Lakey has been incredible, and they've both really pushed me."

"I wouldn't be here without my amazing support team. I felt so much love on this journey this year and it really pushed me through. This year I wanted to do things a little differently, and my non-profit Moore Aloha has really given me that sense of purpose."

"It feels like things have come full circle, and following in Duke's footsteps in the Olympics gives me chills just to think about it."

"I hope to go to Tokyo and spread the aloha spirit, and I'm really proud and honored to represent the USA and in particular, Hawaii."

Moore's 2019 season is a remarkable example of consistency. In the season's ten events, Moore hasn't lost before the Quarterfinals, racking up three wins (South Africa, France, Portugal), two runner-up finishes, three equal 3rds, and two equal 5ths to seal the deal on her fourth World Title.

She is the only Top 17 surfer who managed to advance into the Quarters or better at all the events this year.

Photos by WSL's Cestari, Kirstin, Bonnarme, Rowland, Robertson, Poullenot, Masurel, Morris, Sloane, Dunbar, and Tostee.

name: Winter Vincent
bio: Winter Vincent is a professional surfer known for his fearless approach to big wave surfing. He has competed in major surfing competitions around the world and continues to push the boundaries of the sport.

videos.title: WELCOME WINTER VINCENT | O'NEILL
videos.description:
O'Neill is stoked to welcome Winter Vincent to the team and back with family.  Winter started his surfing journey as a 9-year-old grom, decked head to toe in O'Neill wetsuits and it's great to see him back.  As one of Australia's most promising junior surfers, Winter at age 16, has already packed a fair amount into his young years.  Acting as an ambassador for the Surfrider Foundation, Waves for Water, Kids Give ambassador, has seen Winter raise both awareness and needed funds. 

Most give back at the end of their sporting careers, there's not that many that give at the start.  Nice deeds aside, we see Winter's surfing and his progression as one of the best talents emerging out of the South Pacific region. We look forward to the road ahead and to a bright future no matter what that brings.

name: Zoe Grospiron
bio: Zoe Grospiron is a professional surfer known for her fearless approach to big wave surfing. With multiple championship wins, she is considered one of the top female surfers in the world.

videos.title: SLOW WITH ZO√â GROSPIRON
videos.description:
Ah time! Our dear time, what a pleasure to be talking about you. You who decides of everything, who regulates our day and our life, and, at some point, who defines what is fast and what is, by opposition, slow. Zo√© is definitely fast, running around all day, never losing a second. I, on the contrary, can be considered as slow. My life is basically slow in the morning and not too fast in the afternoon which is funny because you manage to see things differently.

Take a camera for example. Its speed determine how much time its sensor will have to print everything it sees on a card or a film. Set it up on a high shutter speed, at around 1/2000 sec, it will only show you what happens in this timeframe as it will assemble into an image. Less data equals sharp images.
Now, set it up on a low speed, at around 10 sec. With A LOT more data to assemble, it will first take time to process (I told you it was slow...) and then you will end up with a very blurry outcome. No perfect recollection of what happened, but a special interpretation, giving you, more or less, only a vibe of the moment.

And now, welcome to my slow life, where everything is a blur!

With that in mind, and our life being so fast, everyone trying their best to do more and fit the most into their day, I thought it was time to sit down and enjoy the moment. Having Zo√© as a muse was obvious, as she has always been open to new ideas, really motivated, curious and a really smooth and talented longboarder. I also thought mixing someone fast with something slow could be interesting.

And with all that reading, you still don't know what it's about... Don't worry, I'll get to it! So, initially, with this project, I wanted to slow things down (not her surfing though), and focus on things we don't normally have time to focus on. Take gliding for example. How is gliding on a longboard different? How does it feel? What is the best feeling Zo√© can get? Hard questions to answer with words as we don't take time to reflect on them. "Dance", "approach", "elegance", "flying", "addictive", and  "art" came into the discussion which, as you understood, does not focus on surf performance.

To emphasize my point about slow, I decided to shoot Zoe‚Äôs fast surfing with a slow shutter speed, gathering the best moments of our discussion with the best images. All of this topped by a music specially composed to suit her surfing, her style and her feelings. The outcome is about putting the original vibes of surfing into the main focal point, with a slow edit all about the vibes of Zo√© Grospiron's surfing.
